instruction: You'd better be quiet.
response: Thou hast not half that power to do me harm As I have to be hurt.

instruction: Oh, good sir, I am.
response: I pray thee, mark me.

instruction: Dear lady
response: Give me leave, beseech you.

instruction: Why are you crying?
response: At mine unworthiness, that dare not offer What I desire to give, and much less take What I shall die to want.

instruction: Whose tongue?
response: Yours, if you talk of tales.

instruction: Let's hear it.
response: [as CAMBIO] Spit in the hole, man, and tune again.

instruction: What a spoiled pet! If she knew what she was doing, she would have put on a show of weeping.
response: Sister, content you in my discontent.

instruction: I thought that he'd been killed by a bolt of lightning. But arent you drowned, Stephano? I hope now that youre not drowned. Is the storm over? I hid under this dead monsters cloak because I was afraid of the storm. Are you actually alive, Stephano? Oh, Stephano, two of us from Naples survived the shipwreck![TRINCULO grabs STEPHANO and dances him around]
response: Prithee, do not turn me about.

instruction: [To himself] Too far, too far! Friendships that get too close always end with the "friends" having sex. I'm having a heart attack. My heart is racing, but not with excitementdefinitely not. They might as well be relaxed and open with each other here at the party, and blame it on the plentiful food and drink. But holding hands and linking fingers, and smiling stupidly at each other and sighing as if they were having an orgasmthat kind of "party" hurts my heart and my head.[To MAMILLIUS] Mamillius, are you my son?
response: Ay, my good lord.

instruction: Give us the facts, give us the factstell us something about him.
response: Marry, sir, sometimes he is a kind of puritan.

instruction: I'm not eating dinner at home tomorrow. I'm meeting the captains at the castle.
response: Why, then, tomorrow night, or Tuesday morn.

instruction: That's likely, since I'm staying for lunch there.
response: [aside] And supper too, although thou knowst it not.Come, will you go?

instruction: Please, continue. Theres something in your face and eyes that indicates you're talking about something serious, and thatlike giving birthyou're finding it hard to actually get it out.
response: Thus, sir: Although this lord of weak remembrancethis, Who shall be of as little memory When he is earthed hath here almost persuade (For hes a spirit of persuasion only, Professes to persuade) the king his sons alive, 'Tis as impossible th

instruction: You who are more beautiful than words can say, give me some time and let me explain myself.
response: Fouler than heart can think thee, thou canst makeNo excuse current but to hang thyself.

instruction: You keep pushing these words into my ears that I dont have any desire to hear. If only I had never sent my daughter to Tunis to be married! I lost my son because of it. And, as far as I'm concerned, I lost my daughter too, since she is now living so far from Italy that I'll never see her again. Oh, my dear son and heir of Naples and Milan, what strange fish has eaten your dead body?
response: Sir, he may live.

instruction: To do that is within the scope of a man's ability. And therefore I'll give it a try.
response: Where should I lose that handkerchief, Emilia?

instruction: May God grant him health. Did you speak with him?
response: Ay, madam.

instruction: That man makes me feel a lot more confident. It seems to me that he doesnt look like hes fated to die by drowning. Instead he looks like hes destined to die by hanging. Good Fate, hold strong, and make sure that man survives this storm so that one day he can hanged. May the rope fated to hold him by the neck save us, because the ropes we have on the ship dont seem to be helping us much. If hes not fated to be hanged, then things look bleak for us.
response: Down with the topmast!

instruction: [Seeing ROMEOs body] Oh, you rude boy! What terrible manners to die before your father.
response: Seal up the mouth of outrage for a while, Till we can clear these ambiguities And know their spring, their head, their true descent, And then will I be general of your woes, And lead you even to death.

instruction: No, in their lives they were opposed by bad friends.
response: All unavoided is the doom of destiny.

instruction: Goodbye, Thaliard!
response: Till Pericles be dead,My heart can lend no succor to my head.

instruction: What is it, noble man?
response: What will I do, thinkst thou?

instruction: Where are you going?
response: To knock out an honest Athenian's brains.

instruction: The most delicate I've ever smelled. Lift up the lid! Oh, you powerful gods! What's in here? [He looks in] A body!
response: Most strange!

instruction: Just if some trinket should catch your eye and you want to buy itI have the feeling that your store of money isn't large enough for useless purchases.
response: Ill be your purse-bearer and leave youFor an hour.

instruction: And no doubt Petruchio will have a quiet catchno one's going to fight him for her. But now, Baptista, let's think about your younger daughter. This is the day we've been waiting for. I am your neighbor, and I was her first suitor.
response: [as LUCENTIO] And I am one that love Bianca moreThan words can witness or your thoughts can guess.

instruction: So what?
response: Nay, an there were two such, we should have none shortly, for one would kill the other.

instruction: Well, may you have good fortune, good Petruchio! You've won the bet, and I'll add twenty thousand crowns to these two men's losses. It will be a new dowry for a new daughter, for indeed she is so changed that she's like a whole new woman.
response: Nay, I will win my wager better yet,And show more sign of her obedience,Her new-built virtue and obedience.

instruction: And mine.
response: And ours, my lord.

instruction: So when he opens his purse to give us our reward, your conscience will fly out.
response: 'Tis no matter.

instruction: Don't despair, madam.
response: Who shall hinder me?

instruction: [To OTHELLO] You must leave this room and come with us. You have been stripped of your power and command, and Cassio now rules over Cyprus. As for this scoundrel, he will get whatever clever, cruel torture we can devise to cause him a lot of pain for a long time. You will stay a prisoner until the Venetian government hears of your crime. Come on, bring him away.
response: Soft you, a word or two before you go.

instruction: Is it anything less than my death?
response: A gentler judgment vanished from his lips:Not bodys death, but bodys banishment.

instruction: Rise with the lark at dawn tomorrow, gentle Norfolk.
response: I warrant you, my lord.

instruction: I didnt see anybody use you for pleasure. If I had, Id have quickly pulled out my weapon, I assure you. I draw my sword as quickly as any other man if I see a good fight brewing and the law is on my side.
response: Now, afore God, I am so vexed that every part about me quivers.

instruction: The same that I do right now: hate a lord with all my heart.
response: What, thyself?

instruction: My name is Marina.
response: O, I am mock'd,And thou by some incensed god sent hitherTo make the world to laugh at me.

instruction: . . . to have a foolish wife.
response: Oh, is that all?

instruction: No, sir.
response: Thou hast.

instruction: What's going on? What's the news from her?
response: So please my lord, I might not be admitted, But from her handmaid do return this answer: The element itself, till seven years' heat, Shall not behold her face at ample view, But like a cloistress, she will veiled walk And water once a day h

instruction: You are a fool. Get out of here.
response: Alas Iago, What shall I do to win my lord again?

instruction: No, my good lord. Don't distrust me.
response: Where is thy power, then, to beat him back?

instruction: Dismiss me?
response: It was his bidding.

instruction: Yes, I intend to go.
response: Well, I may chance to see you, for I would very fain speak with you.

instruction: I would take on any fighteven a deadly onejust for one loving glance! Oh, it's still proved true that love's curse is a woman who cannot reciprocate love.
response: When Proteus cannot love where he's beloved.

instruction: I am sorry, madam. I've hurt your relative, but I would've had to do the same thing even to my own brother, for I was acting in self-defense. You're looking at me like I'm a stranger, so I can tell that I've offended you. Forgive me, sweet one, for the sake of the vows we made to each other so recently.
response: One face, one voice, one habit, and two persons!A natural perspective, that is and is not!

instruction: What is your name?
response: Cesario is your servants name, fair princess.

instruction: What's going on, Malvolio?
response: Sweet lady, ho, ho.

instruction: Goodbye, Andronicus; Revenge is going now to lay a plot against your enemies.
response: I know thou dost; and, sweet Revenge, farewell.

instruction: [To the servants] Perfect, perfect. Give me the fire and the clothes. Play some sad music, please! Play that violin, you lazy man! Music, please, give her some music. [The servants begin to play while Cerimon uses various medicines and potions on THAISA][To the GENTLEMEN] Gentlemen. The queen will live. Look, she's waking up! She's warm! She's been asleep for about five hours, but look how she comes back to life!
response: The heavens,Through you, increase our wonder and set upYour fame forever.

instruction: Yes. And in reply she says thanks, but no thanks. I wish this fool were married to her grave!
response: Soft, take me with you, take me with you, wife.

instruction: No, please. I won't take your servant from you.
response: Come, come; I love the king your father, and yourself, With more than foreign heart.

instruction: But did she receive my dog?
response: No, indeed, did she not: here have I brought himback again.

instruction: Not her either.
response: Why then, She's fled unto that peasant Valentine; And Eglamour is in her company.

instruction: I ask you to spare the life of my servant, who just today killed a rowdy gentleman that used to serve the Duke of Norfolk.
response: Have I a tongue to doom my brothers death, And shall the tongue give pardon to a slave?

instruction: It's impossible. Who would take your place and be Vincentio's son here in Padua, living in your house and studying your books, welcoming your friends, visiting and dining with your fellow countrymen from Pisa?
response: Basta, content thee, for I have it full.

instruction: I wish I could be as sure of a good dinner.
response: [as LUCENTIO] Gentlemen, God save you.

instruction: Hey, good lieutenant! No, gentlemen! Hey, help! Lieutenantsir MontanoGentlemen, help!Some fine guards these guys are.
response: Whos that which rings the bell?Diablo, ho!

instruction: My beautiful Perdita! But we're in a sticky situation. Camillo, you've rescued my father and now me; you're a life-saver. What should we do? I don't have the clothes and facilities I normally travel with as the prince of Bohemia, and I won't be able to get those things in Sicily.
response: My lord, Fear none of this: I think you know my fortunes Do all lie there: it shall be so my care To have you royally appointed as if The scene you play were mine.

instruction: You, that man, and you the other, each of you still in the company of the other. Each of you is single and alone when apart from the other, but now an enemy keeps you company.[To one of the men] If you promise to rid the world of villains, do not go near the other guy.[To the other] If you swear you will not stand where one villain is, abandon him.[To both] So go away! Here's the gold you came for, you slaves.
response: You have work'd for me; there's payment for you: hence!

instruction: Let him sink there, so the seas will be on him! The cowardly rebel, what is he doing there?
response: I know not, mighty sovereign, but by guess.

instruction: My daughter is a young girl who has never been bold. She is so still and quiet and naturally inclined to blushing. Is it possible that she, in spite of her nature, in spite of her young age, in spite of her nationality, in spite of her reputationin spite of everythingwould fall in love with something she feared to even look at? It would be a foolish misjudgment to think that my perfect daughter could make such a mistake, contrary to all rules of nature. We must find out what cunning evil plots have brought this about. Therefore I say again that he has used some potion on her that affects the blood, or some drug magically enchanted for his purpose.
response: To vouch this is no proof, Without more wider and more overt test Than these thin habits and poor likelihoods Of modern seeming do prefer against him.

instruction: I said something like that, but I only said what I thought might be true.
response: Tell thy story; If thine consider'd prove the thousandth part Of my endurance, thou art a man, and I Have suffer'd like a girl: yet thou dost look Like Patience gazing on kings' graves, and smiling Extremity out of act.

instruction: [To himself] I know who they are, although they think Im crazy. Ill beat them at their own game, this pair of cursed hell-dogs and their mother!
response: Madam, depart at pleasure; leave us here.

instruction: [To PERICLES] Except for you; you're my guest. Here's a victory crown so everyone know's you're the king of the feast.
response: 'Tis more by fortune, lady, than by merit.

instruction: Tut, tut, you've grown icy. Your kindness freezes over. Tell me, do you agree that they must die?
response: Give me some little breath, some pause, dear lord,Before I positively speak in this.I will resolve you herein presently.

instruction: Do you like this jewel, Apemantus?
response: Not so well as plain-dealing, which will not cost aman a doit.

instruction: As soon as Antonio got the hang of how to grant some requests while denying others, of figuring out which people to promote and which to hold back in order to stop them from getting too powerful, he was able to steal the people who used to be mine. He changed them, or, you might say, remade them completely. Having power over both the government and all the people in the government, he could make everyone say or do whatever he wanted them to. He was like ivy growing up a tree, and I was like the treehe covered me entirely until I was hidden, and sucked my vitality out of me. Youre not listening.
response: O, good sir, I do.

instruction: Would your Lordship like to drink a cup of Spanish wine?
response: Will t please your Honor taste of these conserves?

instruction: Don't worry about how I'll handle myself.
response: I once more take my leave.

instruction: Hide under the yew-trees over there, and put your ear against the ground so that youll hear anyone walking through the graveyard. If you hear someone approach, signal me with a whistle. Give me those flowers. Do as I tell you. Go.
response: [Aside] I am almost afraid to stand aloneHere in the churchyard.

instruction: Would you speak on behalf of the Duke of Hereford? If it be so, come out with it boldly, man; I'm eager to hear those who speak good of him.
response: No good at all that I can do for him; Unless you call it good to pity him, Bereft and gelded of his patrimony.

instruction: Oh God, no! God forbid it!
response: Reputation, reputation, reputation!

instruction: I'm performing the violent tragedy of my life. Edwardmy husband, your son, our kingis dead. Why should we keep living when our leader and lifeblood is gone? How can the branches keep growing when the root is gone? Why aren't the leaves withering now that the sap is dried up? If you will live, then lament. If you will die, then be quick about it, so our swift-winged souls might catch up with the king'sor at least follow him, like obedient subjects, into his new kingdom of never-ending night.
response: Ah, so much interest have I in thy sorrow As I had title in thy noble husband.

instruction: Or stole it, rather.
response: Sir, I invite your highness and your train To my poor cell, where you shall take your rest For this one night, whichpart of itIll waste With such discourse as, I not doubt, shall make it Go quick away: the story of my life And the particula

instruction: [Seeing them] But wait, there's more work to be done. Every street, store, church, meeting, and funeral can turn into an opportunity if you're savvy.
response: See, see; what a man you are now!There is no other way but to tell the kingshe's a changeling and none of your flesh and blood.

instruction: Yes, and all we need to do is name the day.
response: Tomorrow, then, I judge a happy day.

instruction: I'll only irritate you if I stay. Let me go.
response: No, not a whit.

instruction: No, stay. You should be honest.
response: I should be wise, for honestys a foolAnd loses that it works for.

instruction: That same villain, Romeo.
response: [Aside] Villain and he be many miles asunder.

instruction: Great God of heaven, say amen to all of this! But tell me, is young George Stanley still alive?
response: He is, my lord, and safe in Leicester town,Whither, if it please you, we may now withdraw us.

instruction: Alive and triumphant, while Mercutio is dead? Begone, respect and compassion. Rage and fury will be my guide. Now, Tybalt, take back the villain that you called me earlier. Mercutios soul is waiting just a bit above our heads for you to join him. Either you, I, or both of us must go with him.
response: Thou, wretched boy, that didst consort him hereShalt with him hence.

instruction: Thats how it it goes with love. My own sadness is a heavy weight on my chest, and now youre going to add your own sadness to mine. The love you are showing me is only increasing my grief. Love is like a smoke made out of the sighs of lovers. When the smoke clears, love is a fire burning in the lovers' eyes. But if that love is thwarted, then it is a sea made out of lovers' tears. What else is love? A wise madness. A sweet candy that makes you choke. Goodbye, my cousin.
response: Soft!

instruction: Hello, many-colored messenger, who never disobeys Juno, the wife of Jupiter. With your golden wings you scatter dewdropsthose refreshing showerson my flowers. You crown my woodlands and fields with each end of your rainbow, making a gorgeous scarf for my delighted earth. Why has your queen summoned me here to this grassy place?
response: A contract of true love to celebrate,And some donation freely to estateOn the blessed lovers.

instruction: It's always like this before times of great change. By some divine instinct, we get nervous when danger is comingjust like when we see the waves swelling before a storm arrives. But leave it all to God. Where are you off to?
response: Marry, we were sent for to the justices.

instruction: Stop talking and go after her!
response: [advancing] How shall I murder him, Iago?

instruction: Yes, a most unhappy one. I would do anything to repair their friendship, because of my love for Cassio.
response: Fire and brimstone!

instruction: Mine too. Do you hear what I'm saying, monster? If I become unhappy with you, be careful
response: Thou wert but a lost monster.

instruction: Well, Petruchio is coming in a new hat and an old jacket, a pair of old pants turned inside out, broken suspenders holding them up, and a pair of boots that have been used as candle holders: one of them buckled, the other laced. He has an old rusty sword from the town armory with a broken hilt and no scabbard. He's riding on a lame horse with an old moth-eaten saddle and two different stirrups, and the horse has swollen glands, a mouth infection, tumors, leg boils, diseased feet, jaundice, swollen ears, palsy, worms, a twisted back, a sprained shoulder, and knock-kneed forelegs. His bit is hanging off and his cheap bridle, which is pulled tight, is pieced together with knots; his saddle strap is patched up and his tail strap is velvet, studded with the initials of some woman, and here and there held together with thread.
response: Who comes with him?

instruction: It wasn't me. It was Chiron and Demetrius; they raped her and cut out her tongue, and so they're responsible for all this.
response: Go fetch them hither to us presently.

instruction: Maybe you're right, but humans can't create anything in nature that doesn't already have the potential to exist; the "engineering" that you say is contrary to nature is actually enabled by nature itself. You see, sweetheart, if we graft a purebred plant to a weed, we can make the weed produce a beautiful flower. This is "engineering" that improves nature, but the engineering itself is all natural.
response: So it is.

instruction: Beat me?
response: Dost thou prate, rogue?

instruction: What did you say, master?
response: Look how thou stirrest now!

instruction: Come on, good wine isn't bad if you don't drink too much of it. Stop swearing against wine. Now, good lieutenant, am I right in thinking that you know I care about you?
response: I have well approved it, sir.

instruction: Did the goddess Diana ever grace a forest like Kate now graces this room with her queenly walk? Oh, you be Diana, then, and let Diana be Kate. Then let Kate be the chaste one, while Diana is my love.
response: Where did you study all this goodly speech?

instruction: [To himself] And you and other men have left me with the readiness that the bird flees from winter weather.[To the others] Dinner is getting cold, gentlemen! Enjoy the music, if you like such humble playing. Let's go.
response: I hope it remains not unkindly with your lordshipthat I returned you an empty messenger.

instruction: He's not yet old enough to be a man, but not young enough to be a boy either. He's like a pea pod or an apple just before it's ripe. He's like a slack tide, caught between coming in and going outbetween boyhood and manhood. He's very good-looking, but he's nagging. It seems like he's just barely stopped breastfeeding.
response: Let him approach.

instruction: They're waiting at the door, sir.
response: O, father, you'll know more of that hereafter.

instruction: Try your legs then sir, and put them in motion.
response: My legs do better understand me, sir, than I understandwhat you mean by bidding me taste my legs.

instruction: Heavenly Diana, silver goddess, I will obey you. Helicanus!
response: Sir?

instruction: [To himself] That won't be anytime soon.
response: Why, sir, I trust I may have leave to speak, And speak I will.

instruction: For both our sakes, I hope that's true.
response: Now, for my life, Hortensio fears his widow.

instruction: I think she'd do better as a soldier. Swords might withstand her, but never lutes.
response: Why, then thou canst not break her to the lute?

instruction: No, listen to me.
response: Go to, then.

instruction: Show me your humble heart, and not your knee; you're only pretending to be dutiful.
response: My gracious uncle

instruction: Oh, good! Convey? Youre all conveyers, taking advantage of a true kings fall to raise yourselves up.
response: On Wednesday next we solemnly set downOur coronation: lords, prepare yourselves.

instruction: Get going.
response: We shall be much unfurnished for this time.What, is my daughter gone to Friar Lawrence?

instruction: Oh, you foul thief! Where have you hidden my daughter? Since you're damned yourself, you probably cast a spell on her! I'll stake my case on plain evidence and common sense as to whether such a tender, beautiful, and happy virgin girlone who was so opposed to marriage that she shunned even the wealthy, good-looking young men of our citywould have ever risked her reputation to run away from her protected home into the dirty embrace of such a thing as you, a thing to be feared and not loved, unless she had been caught by magic. Let the world be my judge: isn't it completely obvious that you have practiced some evil magic on her, and abused her delicate youth with drugs or toxins that make her weak? I'll bring you to court. This is most likely what happened. Therefore, I hereby arrest you as a criminal and a practitioner of illegal black magic. [To the officers] Get a hold of him. If he resists you, subdue him even if it means hurting him.
response: Hold your hands, Both you of my inclining and the rest.

instruction: What's new at court?
response: None rare, my lord.

instruction: Do you think that my uncle was lying, grandmother?
response: Ay, boy.

instruction: "Here, sir! Here, sir! Here, sir! Here, sir!" You blockheaded servants! What, I'll get no service from you? No respect? No duty? Where is the foolish villain I sent ahead of me?
response: Here, sir, as foolish as I was before.

instruction: What, can you say all this and not blush with shame?
response: Ay, like a black dog, as the saying is.

instruction: Three of them claim to have danced for the king, but they're all liars.
response: Leave your prating: since these good men arepleased, let them come in; but quickly now.

instruction: Please Apemantus, could you read the different lines in these letters? I can't make any sense of them.
response: Canst not read?

instruction: [As LUCENTIO] Well, sir, I'll do you a favor, and help you out and give you some advice. But first tell me, have you ever been to Pisa?
response: Ay, sir, in Pisa have I often been,Pisa renownèd for grave citizens.

instruction: Are you going to the forest, or the town?
response: If to either, thou dost ill.

instruction: It would be better if they were all on his father's side, or if none at all were on his father's side. For as it is, the contest over which uncles will be closest to the king is likely to affect all of us, if God doesn't prevent it. The Duke of GloucesterRichardis a dangerous man. And Queen Elizabeth's sons and brothers are haughty and proud. This sickly country will only have a chance of being healed if they end up as subjects, not rulers.
response: Come, come, we fear the worst.

instruction: Oh, if only the cities that have enough, who enjoy the tastes of prosperity, with their superfluous riots, would hear these tears! One day, they could be as miserable as Tarsus.
response: Where's the lord governor?

instruction: The place where you live proclaims you to be a prostitute.
response: Do you know this house to be a place of such resort,and will come into 't?

instruction: Peter, did you ever see the likes of this?
response: He kills her in her own humor.

instruction: Now youre just going to talk again about banishment.
response: Ill give thee armor to keep off that word Adversitys sweet milk, philosophyTo comfort thee though thou art banishèd.

instruction: Why, she's not coming to borrow money from them.
response: Welcome home, Grumio.

instruction: Come on, sir, please, let's go.
response: Let me speak a little.

instruction: Oh, shut the door! And when youve done that, come weep with me. My situation is beyond hope, beyond cure, beyond help!
response: O Juliet, I already know thy grief.

instruction: My Lord Aumerle, I know youll be ashamed to take back what you said before. When we were plotting the Duke of Gloucesters death, I heard you say: Isnt my arm long enough to reach my uncles head in Calais? And among other things, that time, I heard you say that you would rather refuse a hundred thousand pounds than see Bolingbroke ever come back to England, adding what a blessing you thought it would be if your cousin died.
response: Princes and noble lords, What answer shall I make to this base man?

instruction: What, what, Lychorida!
response: Patience, good sir; do not assist the storm.

instruction: Such a calm submission is both dishonorable and vile! The thrust of a sword will sweep it away. [Draws his sword] Tybalt, you rat-catcher, will you duel with me?
response: What wouldst thou have with me?

instruction: I can't tell what's going on. The world has grown so bad that little wrens now live where eagles dare not perch. Since every peasant has become a nobleman, there are now many noblemen who've been turned into peasants.
response: Come, come, we know your meaning, brother Gloucester.

instruction: [So only TRANIO can hear] But her sister is silent, and seems to have a proper girl's mildness and obedience. Quiet, Tranio.
response: [aside to LUCENTIO ] Well said, master.

instruction: Please, tell me one thing first.
response: Come now, your one thing.

instruction: A greater gift? Oh, that must mean a sword.
response: Ay, gentle cousin, were it light enough.

instruction: Oh, who has done this to you?
response: Nobody.

instruction: I come as Varro's servant, sir
response: From Isidore;He humbly prays your speedy payment.

instruction: It's gotten too much praise. If I paid you based on how much it's been praised, I would go broke.
response: My lord, 'tis rated As those which sell would give: but you well know, Things of like value differing in the owners Are prized by their masters: believe't, dear lord, You mend the jewel by the wearing it.

instruction: You had a Clarence too, and Richard killed him. The kennel of your womb has let loose a hellhound that hunts us all to deatha dog that had teeth before it had eyes. His teeth attack lambs and lap up their gentle blood. He is the greatest tyrant of the earth, and thrives among the tears of those he has injured. That foul creature who defaces God's handiwork came forth from your womb to chase us to our graves. Oh, upright, just, and generous God, how can I thank you enough that this deadly mutt preys on his mother's offspring and makes her a companion to others' sorrow?
response: O Harrys wife, triumph not in my woes!

instruction: Who, Camillo?
response: Camillo, sir; I spake with him; who now Has these poor men in question.

instruction: Damn her inexperience!
response: 'Faith, there's no way to be rid on't but by theway to the pox.

instruction: Well said. Sit then, and talk with her. She is yours. Come here, Ariel! My busy servant, Ariel!
response: What would my potent master?

instruction: Strong as a tower in my hopes, I cry out "amen."
response: Go bear this lance to Thomas, Duke of Norfolk.

instruction: This is how strangers are mistreated and abused!Oh you monstrous villain!
response: O!

instruction: You think my mind will be changed that easily, like a feather carried on the wind? Do you expect me to wait around until this bastard can kneel and call me "father?" It's better to burn it now than to deal with it then. But fine, let it live. I'll neither burn it nor keep it.[To ANTIGONUS] You! You've been in cahoots with the Wicked Witch, your wife, to save this bastard's life (and it is a bastard, as sure as my beard is gray). What are you willing to do to save this brat's life?
response: Any thing, my lord,That my ability may undergoAnd nobleness impose: at least thus much:I'll pawn the little blood which I have leftTo save the innocent: any thing possible.

instruction: I think you're about to turn back into a baby!
response: Were I chief lord of all this spacious world, I'ld give it to undo the deed.

instruction: Oh, help me!
response: Thats one of them.

instruction: The same to you, sir! I owe you for that lovely singing last night. I swear I've never heard such a great voice.
response: It is your grace's pleasure to commend;Not my desert.

instruction: Never, Paulina, God bless my soul!
response: Then, good my lords, bear witness to his oath.

instruction: Quiet your outrage for a time, until we can clear up the remaining uncertainties about the cause of all this. Once we do know what happened, I will lead you in expressing our pain, all the way to our deaths. In the meantime, hold on, and let your patience control your desire to act. Bring forth the men under suspicion.
response: I am the greatest, able to do least, Yet most suspected, as the time and place Doth make against me, of this direful murder.

instruction: It's appropriate that I am treated like this, very appropriate. What have I ever done to make him find the smallest thing to complain about?
response: What is your pleasure, madam?

instruction: [As CAMBIO] Enough, fiddler! You grow too forward, sir. Have you already forgotten how her sister Katherina thanked you for your insistence?
response: [as LITIO] But, wrangling pedant, this is The patroness of heavenly harmony.

instruction: How's it going, Grumio?
response: What, Grumio!

instruction: Why, that is nothing. I tell you, father, I am as domineering as she is proud-minded, and when two raging fires come together, they cancel each other out. A little wind will make a little fire great, but a great gust will blow the fire out. I'll be the great gust to her fire, and she will yield to me, for I am rough and don't woo like a child.
response: Well mayst thou woo, and happy be thy speed.But be thou armed for some unhappy words.

instruction: Richard of York, how are you, my loving brother?
response: Well, my dread lordso must I call you now.

instruction: Then it shouldnt matter who sees it; I will be satisfied in this. Let me see the letter.
response: I do beseech your grace to pardon me: It is a matter of small consequence, Which for some reasons I would not have seen.

instruction: I have naught to do with this, my lord.
response: Naught to do with Mistress Shore?

instruction: Some men think so. Go now and take your dogs with you.
response: We but offend him.

instruction: Then bring them before us: we will hear the accuser and the accused make their case, face to face. They're both proud men, full of anger, and their rage makes them too hasty and quick to take offense.
response: Many years of happy days befalMy gracious sovereign, my most loving liege!

instruction: If you knew who I was, you'd talk to me.
response: I am not mad; I know thee well enough: Witness this wretched stump, witness these crimson lines; Witness these trenches made by grief and care, Witness the tiring day and heavy night; Witness all sorrow, that I know thee well For our proud

instruction: [To the gentlemen] If you're loyal to me, you better get her out of this room! If I were a tyrant, she would be dead by now. She wouldn't dare to call me that if she actually thought I were one. Take her away!
response: I pray you, do not push me; I'll be gone.

instruction: Ill go, sir, and not interfere.
response: So shalt thou show me friendship.

instruction: Let him do his worst. My good deeds done in service to the city government will have more influence than his complaints. It's not yet well-knownand I won't spread this news until I hear that it's an honor to boastbut I am descended from men of royal lineage. So I'm worthy of the noble fortune of Desdemona's family. And know this, Iago: if I didn't love the gentle Desdemona, I wouldn't give up all my freedom for the confines and restrictions of marriagenot in return for all the treasure in the sea. But look, what light is that, coming from over there?
response: Those are the raisèd father and his friends.You were best go in.

instruction: [To ARIEL so that only he can hear] My ingenious spirit!
response: These are not natural events.

instruction: Katherine, I want you to tell these headstrong women what kind of obedience they owe to their lords and husbands.
response: Come, come, youre mocking.

instruction: Knights, I hardly need to say how welcome you are. To write an endorsement of the book of your good deeds, like on a title page, would be more than is needed, since you've already showed your worth by doing the deeds themselves. So, get ready to laugh, since feasts are best enjoyed with laughter. All of you princes are my guests.
response: But you, my knight and guest;To whom this wreath of victory I give,And crown you king of this day's happiness.

instruction: Aha! Does she?
response: [t o FABIAN and MARIA ] Go to, go to!

instruction: [Kneeling and exposing his neck] I sharpened the axe myself. Just strike the blow.
response: Rise, prithee, rise.

instruction: Is Leontes all right?
response: He something seems unsettled.

instruction: [Looks at weapon] What's this? A scroll tied around? Let's see.[Reads] "Integer vitae, scelerisque purus, / Non eget Mauri jaculis, nec arcu."
response: O, 'tis a verse in Horace; I know it well:I read it in the grammar long ago.

instruction: Certainly, men should be what they seem to be.
response: Why then I think Cassios an honest man.

instruction: Banish us both and send the king with me.
response: That were some love but little policy.

instruction: My luck . . . parents . . . good parents . . . like me! Was it really? What did you say?
response: I said, my lord, if you did know my parentage,You would not do me violence.

instruction: Who is your lord?
response: He that is yours, sweet lady.

instruction: You are welcome, sir.
response: And yet I come not well.

instruction: Not under the advice of a man even more miserable. You are a slave, a dog, who was always unlucky. If you were born like I was into a sweet life this world gives to whoever it likes, you would have gone crazy and wasted your youth in lusty beds. You would never have learned hard reason, but instead followed all temptations before you. But I, who was born right in the place where all sweet things are made, and where countless mouths, tongues, eyes, and hearts of men waited at my command, stuck to me like leaves stick to an oak, I was abandoned by all them, as if those leaves had all dropped at the first sight of winter and left me bare to feel every storm. Trust me, you who never knew any better, bearing this tragedy is a great burden. Your life began in suffering, and you have grown used to it. Why should you hate men? They never flattered you? What did you give them? If you will curse anyone it should be your father, because he had sex with some poor woman out of spite and conceived you. So just go away! If you had not been born in the worst position, you would have been a false flatterer.
response: Art thou proud yet?

instruction: Only so that she can give up that title, as her mother has.
response: Say I will love her everlastingly.

instruction: I swear, that seems the truth. For himself to ruin, he says. Gentlemen, can any of you tell me where I can find young Romeo?
response: I can tell you, but young Romeo will be older when you have found him than he was when you sought him.

instruction: Truly, I think they have.
response: Oh, heaven, how got she out?

instruction: You're lying through your teeth. Queen Margaret saw your murderous sword steaming with his bloodthe same sword with which you once tried to kill her. She was only saved because your brothers restrained you.
response: I was provokèd by her sland'rous tongue,That laid their guilt upon my guiltless shoulders.

instruction: [To QUEEN ELIZABETH] Cheer up, mother. How are you feeling?
response: O Dorset, speak not to me.

instruction: No, good sailor, I'll dock here a little longer. My lady, would you call off your giant here?
response: Tell me your mind.

instruction: I never saw a better-made gown, or one more elegant, pleasing, and praiseworthy. It seems like you're trying to make a plaything out of me.
response: Why, true, he means to make a puppet of thee.

instruction: Well then, there are many monsters in big cities, and many monsters that pass for men.
response: Did he confess it?

instruction: Many thanks, friend. Go on. This is helping. Your advice is good, so I know the rest of it will comfort me.
response: Master, you looked so longly on the maid, Perhaps you marked not whats the pith of all.

instruction: I can only repeat what I've memorized, and that question isn't part of my lines. Please, gentle lady, just assure me that you are the lady of the house, so I can go on with my speech.
response: Are you a comedian?

instruction: Be calm. Don't be scared. Tell your heart, which is full of pity, that no harm was done to anyone.
response: Oh, woe the day!

instruction: I'm a man whom the waves and the wind have hit around like a tennis ball all day in gigantic tennis court of the sea. Please, have pity on me. I'm asking you, and I don't usually beg.
response: No, friend, cannot you beg?

instruction: He'll stay, sweetheart.
response: At my request he would not.Hermione, my dearest, thou never spokestTo better purpose.

instruction: Farewell, sweet teachers. I must go.
response: [as CAMBIO] Faith, mistress, then I have no cause to stay.

instruction: How did we land here?
response: By providence divine.

instruction: [To LODOVICO] This is Othello's flag-bearer, I think.
response: The same indeed, a very valiant fellow.

instruction: No doubt, my lord.
response: O Ratcliffe, I fear, I fear.

instruction: [To PERDITA] Chin up, sweetheart. Nothing that my father does can change the love we have for each other. [To LEONTES] Sir, I beg youthink of what you were like when you were my age and in love. Defend me to my father. If you ask, he'll give you an expensive gift as quickly as if it were a cheap one.
response: Would he do so, I'ld beg your precious mistress,Which he counts but a trifle.

instruction: May your angels protect us, heaven! What were those things?
response: A living drollery.

instruction: My husband?
response: Ay, twas he that told me on her first.

instruction: Did you pick up on that?[To himself] They're all gossiping about me already, whispering, "Leontes is such-and-such." It'll be too late by the time I hear about it. Camillo, why did he finally decide to stay?
response: At the good queen's entreaty.

instruction: You devil! [He hits DESDEMONA]
response: I have not deserved this.

instruction: Back off, if you see him get angry.
response: Come, Sir Andrew, theres no remedy.

instruction: Go, some of you, and convey him to the Tower.
response: O, good!

instruction: Then give me permission to go.
response: Whither?

instruction: Go, tie up those dangling apricots, which overburden their parent tree with their weight, like unruly childrengive some support to the bending twigs. Go and, like an executioner, cut off the heads of plants that grow too fast and too high: in our commonwealth, this garden, we must govern fairly and make sure no plant is taller than the others. While you're busy with that, I'll pull out the useless weeds that suck the soil's nutrients from our healthy flowers.
response: Why should we in the compass of a pale Keep law and form and due proportion, Showing, as in a model, our firm estate, When our sea-walled garden, the whole land, Is full of weeds, her fairest flowers choked up, Her fruit-trees all upturned,

instruction: When daffodils begin to bloom,(Say "hey!") roll around in the grass with your loverSince spring, the best time of the year, is here,After a winter of waiting and wanting.The clean white sheets hanging out to dry(Say "hey!") and the birds' beautiful singingHave me hankering for a hook-up.I'm no snoban ugly girl satisfies as much as any other.The lark that chirps, "tweet, tweet!"(Say "hey!" Say "hey!"), the thrush, and the blue jayAre the perfect soundtrack for me and my ladies,While we get down in the hay.[He interrupts his song] I served Prince Florizel back in the day and used to wear a fancy suit, but now I'm out of a job.But am I crying over that, sweetheart?The moon shines in the night:Its light guides me as I wander around after-hoursAt which time I (mostly) do good.If we tolerate handymenWho live on a piss-poor budgetThen I might as well "fix" my income.I'll pay for it with jail time if I have to.I'm in the sheets business. If you see a hawk like me swooping in, you better get out your second-best linens. My father named me "Autolycus." Like me, he was destined to be a thief, and, like me, he spent his time snapping up overlooked goodies. I paid for this outfit by pimpingnot to mention the additional profit of cheap booty. The threats of jail and death are pretty real out here on the street. I live in constant fear of being beaten or hanged, and I can't even think about the afterlife! I drink to forget about it.[Seeing the shepherd's son] Ah, here's a treat!
response: Let me see: every 'leven wether tods; every todyields pound and odd shilling; fifteen hundredshorn.

instruction: And can't young men die as well as old men?
response: Well, gentlemen, I am thus resolved.

instruction: I do. He sent me an invitation, and when I said I had other engagements, he pressed me further and told me I had to come.
response: In like manner was I in debt to my importunate business, but he would not hear my excuse.

instruction: The tears havent won much, since my face wasnt all that nice before I started to cry.
response: Thou wrongst it more than tears with that report.

instruction: It's no problem for me, sir, as I'm only begging on a beggar's behalf. The famous lover Cressida became a beggar in her old age, they say. My lady is inside, sir. I'll explain where you come from, but who you are and what you want are beyond my knowledge. I'd say I'm "not in my element," but those words are overused.
response: This fellow is wise enough to play the fool, And to do that well craves a kind of wit.

instruction: But I say it wasn't him, and I am sure you will believe me, even if you were inclined to think otherwise .
response: You, my lords, Look on her, mark her well; be but about To say 'she is a goodly lady,' and The justice of your hearts will thereto add 'Tis pity she's not honest, honourable:' Praise her but for this her without-door form, Which on my faith

instruction: [To ANTONIO] Alonso enjoys these comforting words about as much as he enjoys cold soup.
response: [to SEBASTIAN] The visitor will not give him o'er so.

instruction: Paulina, I won't marry until you tell me.
response: ThatShall be when your first queen's again in breath;Never till then.

instruction: What are you all laughing at?
response: Who can be other in this royal presence?

instruction: Your master will be dead before you get back; there's no way on earth to help him now.[To PHILEMON] Give this to the doctor, and tell me how it works.
response: Good morrow.

instruction: Yes, but the leopard won't change its spots: to take that gage from me is to take my honor. My dear dear lord, the purest treasure of our lives is spotless reputation: without that, men are just painted clay and gilded dust. A brave spirit in a loyal person is like a jewel in a chest protected by ten locks. My honor is my life; both grow together. If you take my honor from me, my life is done. Then, my dear liege, let me prove my integrity in combat: I live for my honor and will die for it.
response: Cousin, throw up your gage; do you begin.

instruction: I did, my lord.
response: And buried, gentle Tyrrel?

instruction: Oh my liege, pardon me, if you please; if not, I will be content not to be pardoned. Will you seize and grip into your hands all the rightful inheritance of banished Hereford? Isn't Gaunt dead, and doesn't Hereford live? Was not Gaunt fair, and is not Harry loyal? Didn't Gaunt deserve to have an heir? Is not his heir a well-deserving son? Take Hereford's rights away, and you take away ancient customs and rights: tomorrow won't come after today, and you won't be yourselffor how are you a king except by fair inheritance and succession? Now, before GodGod forbid my prediction comes true!if you wrongfully seize Hereford's rights, taking away his legal right to the income and honors of the dukedom of Lancaster, you bring a thousand dangers on your head, you lose a thousand hearts that would have been well-disposed towards you, and you test my patience by bringing me to thoughts which honor and allegiance cannot allow me to think.
response: Think what you will, we seize into our handsHis plate, his goods, his money and his lands.

instruction: [Looking at VIOLA] Is that me standing there? I never had a brother, and I'm not a god who can be everywhere at once. I had a sister, but she was drowned by the cruel ocean. Please tell me, are you related to me? What country are you from? What is your name? Who are your parents?
response: Of Messaline.

instruction: Lets get out of here, Tybalt.
response: I am hurt.A plague o both your houses!

instruction: Please, lead the way without doing any more talking. Trinculo, since the king and everyone else we were with have drowned, were the rightful owners of this place. Here, carry my wine bottle. My good friend Trinculo, well fill that bottle again soon.
response: [sings drunkenly] Farewell, master!

instruction: [Sitting down] My life has died. My sight has gone blind. I'm like a ghost that's still alive. I am the bearer of misfortune; the shame of the world; a soul that rightfully belongs to the grave. As a summary and brief record of my unbearable life, I will rest my restless bones on England's lawful earth, which is now covered with innocent blood, against the laws of man and nature.
response: [sitting down beside her] Ah, that thou wouldst as soon afford a grave As thou canst yield a melancholy seat, Then would I hide my bones, not rest them here.

instruction: Every little thing.
response: [to FERDINAND] Come, follow.

instruction: then we could get rid of all the men that are robbing the king of his wealth.
response: [Aside] How from the finny subject of the sea These fishers tell the infirmities of men; And from their watery empire recollect All that may men approve or men detect!

instruction: My mistake.
response: Why do you speak so faintly?Are you not well?

instruction: Dont be sad too, fair woman; it will bring me to my end sooner. Good soul, pretend that our old life was a happy dream that weve not woken up from. My only companion now is Necessity, sweetheart, and Ill be with him until my death. Go to France to some religious house; well find another crown in heaven, although weve lost the ones we had on earth.
response: What, is my Richard both in shape and mind Transform'd and weaken'd?

instruction: Camillo, if you're loyal to me, you wouldn't think of leaving me now; I need your services especially (and, since I've been spoiled with a servant as effective as you, I can hardly settle for someone else). Plus, you've built industries for me here that no one but you can take care of, so you either need to stay here to do it yourself, or take your projects with you. I can never thank you enough for all the work you've doneand for your friendship. Please, don't talk about Sicily anymore. The name alone dredges up bad memories of that "remorseful" king (as you call him), my friend, and the loss of his wife and children, which we should be mourning even now. Anyway, when did you last see my son, Prince Florizel? It's just as bad for a king to misplace a good son as to have a bad one at hand.
response: Sir, it is three days since I saw the prince.

instruction: Flatter me in my sorrow then. Tell me what rank, what dignity, or what honor you could possibly offer to any child of mine?
response: Even all I have ay, and myself and all Will I withal endow a child of thine; So in the Lethe of thy angry soul Thou drown the sad remembrance of those wrongs Which thou supposest I have done to thee.

instruction: We'll appreciate it, my lord.
response: Will you, indeed?

instruction: You never inhabited the middle ranks of humanity, only the very rich and the very poor. When you were basking in gold in perfume, they all mocked you for your meticulousness. In your tattered rags you don't have any of that left, but are despised for being messy and dirty. Here's a little fruit for you, eat it.
response: On what I hate I feed not.

instruction: You are my husband and my lord, my lord and my husband, and I am your obedient wife.
response: I know it well.What must I call her?

instruction: Yes. We do all have the same goal, and mine is money.
response: So is theirs and ours.

instruction: Well, if you're someone who accepts challenges, then I'll challenge you.
response: O good Sir Toby, hold!

instruction: What kind of foul-mouthed jerk are you?
response: I am one, sir, that comes to tell you your daughter andthe Moor are now making the beast with two backs.

instruction: Bless you, Apollo!
response: Praised!

instruction: Whaf if I ask you to stay?
response: It cannot be.

instruction: I hope you're lucky enough to hear the true story. Come on, madam, lets go.
response: Good morrow, cousin.

instruction: "To Jove," that's for you; here, "To Apollo"; "To Mars," that's for me. Here, boy, to Pallas; here, to Mercury; to Saturn; Caius. Not to Saturnineyou might as well shoot against the wind. Get to it, boy! Marcus, let your arrow fly when I tell you. I swear Ive written to every god for justice.
response: Kinsmen, shoot all your shafts into the court:We will afflict the emperor in his pride.

instruction: Goodbye, my lord: I see bravery and virtue in your eyes. Order the fight, marshal, and begin.
response: Harry of Hereford, Lancaster and Derby,Receive thy lance; and God defend the right!

instruction: I have a jewel right here
response: O, pray, let's see't: for the Lord Timon, sir?

instruction: I told you, sir, they were wildly drunkso full of inflated courage that they were striking at the air with their swords for blowing in their faces, and hitting the ground for touching their feet. Yet at the same time theyve never lost sight of their plan. Then I beat my drum, at whichlike colts that had never been riddenthey pricked up their ears, looked around, and lifted their noises as if to smell the music. So with my music I put a spell on their ears that made them follow me like trusting calves through sharp-leaved bushes, prickly shrubs, and thornsall of which stuck in their vulnerable shins. Finally, I left them in the middle of the scum-covered pond behind your hut, with the stinking water lapping at their chins.
response: This was well done, my bird.

instruction: Who is his noble cousinmost wicked king! But, lords, we hear this fearful tempest coming, but see no shelter in which to hide from the storm; we see the wind wreck our sails, and if we don't strike back, we'll surely die.
response: We see the very wreck that we must suffer; And unavoided is the danger now, For suffering so the causes of our wreck.

instruction: Almost as well as I know myself. I have thought about her suffering a hundred times, and it has made me cry.
response: Belike she thinks that Proteus hath forsook her.

instruction: Now youve hit it.
response: A most courteous exposition.

instruction: Please, Timon, tell us what it is.
response: You'll take it ill.

instruction: I was saying: he used magic to take over this island. He took it from me. If your Highness will take revenge on himbecause I know that you're brave enough to do it, though this thing [He points to TRINCULO] wouldn't dare
response: Thats most certain.

instruction: Apemantus is inhuman. Come, shall we go in and taste Lord Timon's bounty? He exceeds the meaning of the word kindness.
response: He pours it out; Plutus, the god of gold, Is but his steward: no meed, but he repays Sevenfold above itself; no gift to him, But breeds the giver a return exceeding All use of quittance.

instruction: Good god! Is that hateful man in tatters, looking so down and out, really my lord? Oh he is a memorial of what happens when good deeds are received ungratefully! Poverty has made such a remarkable change to his honorable appearance! How vile his friends were to bring down such a great man! It really shows the accuracy of that saying, "Love your enemies!" I would indeed much rather love those who wish me harm to my face than those who pretend to be my friends and stab me in the back.[Noticing TIMON] He has seen me, and I will show him how much I grieve for him, and how I promise still to serve him. My fine master!
response: Away!

instruction: And yet I fear you, because when your eyes roll like that I know you're in a deadly mood. I don't know why I should be afraid, since I am not guilty of anything. But I am afraid nonetheless.
response: Think on thy sins.

instruction: Whose is it, then?
response: I know not neither, I found it in my chamber.

instruction: He's a senseless villain, good Hortensio. I told the rascal to knock on your door and couldn't for the life of me get him to do it.
response: Knock at the gate?

instruction: Of course, once the most important thing has been obtainedher love, that is. That is everything.
response: Why, that is nothing.

instruction: Oh, Fortune. People say that you are fickle, always changing your mind. If you are so fickle, what will you do to Romeo, who is so renowned for being faithful? Be fickle, Fortune, and do not keep him away long. Instead send him back to Verona soon.
response: [From within] Ho, daughter, are you up?

instruction: Because the girl shouldn't live any longer after having been dishonored, and by staying alive she reminds him of his grief.
response: A reason mighty, strong, and effectual; A pattern, precedent, and lively warrant, For me, most wretched, to perform the like.

instruction: I know your reputation, and I have a lot of respect for you.
response: Pray you then,Conduct me to the queen.

instruction: Just now, my lord.
response: It is the very error of the moon,She comes more nearer earth than she was wont And makes men mad.

instruction: Tut, tut, my lord, we won't stand around and chat. Talkers are not good doers. Rest assured that we go to use our hands, not our tongues.
response: Your eyes drop millstones, when fools' eyes drop tears.I like you lads.

instruction: It is my wretched fate.
response: Beshrew him for t!How comes this trick upon him?

instruction: Who should begin?
response: That will I.Go, Biondello, bid your mistress come to me.

instruction: I beg your pardon, but it will be good for me to walk.
response: Madam, good night.

instruction: Who is she?
response: She that I spake of, our great captains captain, Left in the conduct of the bold Iago, Whose footing here anticipates our thoughts A se'nnights speed.

instruction: You say this, but you have no proof. You have no clear evidence beyond your thin accusations and poor guesses based on his appearance.
response: But, Othello, speak.

instruction: [From offstage] Who's that calling?
response: Sir Topas the curate, who comes to visit Malvolio the lunatic.

instruction: My God! What trouble I must have been to you then!
response: Oh, a cherubim Thou wast that did preserve me.

instruction: Oh, how that name fits me! Old Gaunt indeed, and gaunt in being old: grief has made me lose my appetite, and the man who doesn't eat loses weight. I've stayed up late to keep an eye on sleeping England, and lack of sleep makes you thin too. And I am fasting as well of the pleasure that some fathers feed onby which I mean the sight of my childrenand so by depriving me of that, you have made me gaunt: I am gaunt for the grave, gaunt as a grave, whose hollow womb inherits nothing but bones.
response: Can sick men play so nicely with their names?

instruction: That you are well descended.
response: [Aside] True; from a gentleman to a fool.

instruction: Then, noble listeners, you should all know that it was Chiron and Demetrius who murdered our emperor's brother and raped our sister. For their foul crimes our brothers were beheaded, and my father's tears were mocked and his handthe hand which has fought so many battles for Rome and sent her enemies to the gravecut off as a joke. Lastly, I was unkindly banished from Rome. The gates shut on me and I turned away crying, and went to seek help from Rome's enemies. They drowned their hatred for Rome in my own honest tears and treated me as their friend. I'm the one who was turned away and yet I have saved Rome with my own blood, turning the knife's point away from her and allowing it to pierce my own body. Oh, you know that I'm no boaster; my scars (although they're silent) can prove that what I say is fair and honest. But wait! I think I'm talking too much in praise of myself. Forgive me, for people praise themselves when friends aren't around to do it for them.
response: Now is my turn to speak.

instruction: Is Sir Lucentio inside, sir?
response: [as VINCENTIO] Hes within, sir, but not to be spoken withal.

instruction: That is a deed that you will die for.
response: Right, if doing nothing be death by the law.

instruction: May you reign many years in happiness, my gracious King, my most loving lord!
response: Each day still better other's happiness ; Until the heavens, envying earth's good hap, Add an immortal title to your crown!

instruction: He won't marry again unless another woman, the spitting image of Hermione, crosses his eye.
response: Good madam,

instruction: [Singing while helping PROSPERO dress]Where the bee drinks, I do too.In the cup of a cowslip flower is where I lie.That's where I sleep when the owls hoot.I fly on a bats backJoyfully chasing summer around the Earth.Happily, happily I will live nowUnder the blossom that hangs on the branch.
response: Why, thats my dainty Ariel.

instruction: Oh, "Doricles," you exaggerate. If it weren't oh-so-obvious that you're nothing more than an innocent shepherd, I'm afraid I'd think you were just trying to get in my pants!
response: I think you haveAs little skill to fear as I have purposeTo put you to't.

instruction: [To himself] He's going to ask Lucius and Lucullus, of all people?
response: Go you, sir, to the senators Of whom, even to the state's best health, I have Deserved this hearing bid 'em send o' the instant A thousand talents to me.

instruction: Mistress!
response: My lord?

instruction: Find him and tell him to come to me. Tell him I have persuaded my husband on his behalf, and I hope that everything will be resolved.
response: To do this is within the compass of mans wit, and therefore I will attempt the doing it.

instruction: Prepare yourself with whatever fighting defenses you have. I don't know what you've done to insult him, but someone is full of defiance and bloodthirstiness towards you, and he waits for you at the end of the garden. Draw your sword and prepare yourself swiftly, for your assailant is quick, skillful, and deadly.
response: You mistake, sir.

instruction: Then, as a gift from me and as your well-earned reward, take my daughter. But if you take her virginity before the marriage ceremony is performed according to all the sacred traditions, the heavens will not shower blessings on your marriage. Instead, empty hate, bitter disrespect, and conflict will ruin your marriage until you both grow to despise it. So listen to what I'm saying if you want to have a happy marriage blessed by Hymen.
response: As I hope For quiet days, fair issue, and long life, With such love as tis now, the murkiest den, The most opportune place, the strongst suggestion, Our worser genius can shall never melt Mine honor into lust to take away The edge of that d

instruction: Orphans never suffered so great a loss.
response: Was never mother had so dear a loss.

instruction: [To RICHARD] May I weigh down your soul tomorrow! It's me, Rivers, who died at Pomfret. Despair, and die!
response: [to RICHARD] Think upon Grey, and let thy soul despair!

instruction: He wounded too many men. He's a crazy drunk, and that vice ruins his honor. He would fight even if he had no enemies, and in his temper he has committed many crimes and encourages rebellion. We have been told that he is a dangerous and wicked man.
response: He dies.

instruction: Count my blood drop by drop and take it from me.
response: Five thousand drops pays that.What yours?and yours?

instruction: Yes my lord?
response: The little casket bring me hither.

instruction: Lord Cerimon has received trustworthy letters saying my father's dead.
response: Heavens make a star of him!

instruction: Why do you look so sad today, your Grace?
response: O, I have passed a miserable night, So full of ugly dreams, of ugly sights, That, as I am a Christian faithful man, I would not spend another such a night Though twere to buy a world of happy days, So full of dismal terror was the time.

instruction: Do you ladies have no manners? Is this how you treat each other? Isn't there some other place where you could call each other names, instead of doing it here in front of all our guests? Now everyone's whispering about you. Please shut up; don't say anything else.
response: I have done.

instruction: I die as an innocent.
response: Oh, who hath done this deed?

instruction: If they just overheard me, I'm dead.
response: How now, good fellow!

instruction: Hey, what time is it?
response: I am thus bold to put your Grace in mindOf what you promised me.

instruction: I'll have you burned to death.
response: I care not: It is an heretic that makes the fire, Not she which burns in't.

instruction: Well, I can go too, can't I? What, do I have to start making appointments now, as if I didn't know when to come and go?
response: You may go to the devils dam!

instruction: Are you scared?
response: No, monster, not I.

instruction: Then tell us immediately what you know about all this.
response: I will be brief, for my short date of breath Is not so long as is a tedious tale.

instruction: Of course I can, sir.
response: By what?

instruction: Ha, don't worry about me.
response: [as LUCENTIO] But hast thou done thy errand to Baptista?

instruction: Ah, Tranio, what a cruel father he is! But didn't you hear how he wanted to hire good tutors to instruct her?
response: Ay, marry, am I, sir; and now tis plotted!

instruction: Who is that?
response: Feste, the jester, my lord, a fool that the lady Olivias father took much delight in.

instruction: Is there more work to do? Since youre giving me new chores, let me remind you what you promised to me but havent yet actually done for me.
response: How now?

instruction: Please stop arguing with me. Will you do him well? He'll give you a lot of money.
response: What he will do graciously, I will thankfully receive.

instruction: It won't be the first time someone has had to call me "villain." You begin, Fool. It begins, "Shut your mouth."
response: I shall never begin if I hold my peace.

instruction: Are you still so cruel?
response: Still so constant, lord.

instruction: What shrill-voiced petitioner is shouting at us?
response: A woman, and thy aunt, great king; 'tis I.Speak with me, pity me, open the door.A beggar begs that never begg'd before.

instruction: Set down, set down your honorable load, menif honor can be shrouded in a coffinwhile I solemnly mourn the early death of virtuous Henry.
response: Poor key-cold figure of a holy king, Pale ashes of the house of Lancaster, Thou bloodless remnant of that royal blood, Be it lawful that I invocate thy ghost To hear the lamentations of poor Anne, Wife to thy Edward, to thy slaughtered son,

instruction: Any man who can write is able to answer a letter.
response: Nay, he will answer the letters master, how he dares, being dared.

instruction: Yes.
response: Why, this is the world's soul; and just of the same piece Is every flatterer's spirit.

instruction: That won't matter. Let it fly off. No one will take it in.
response: What if it come to thee again?

instruction: Silence! If you say another word, Ill scold you, maybe even hate you. What, youre taking the side of an impostor? Be quiet. You think no one else is as beautiful as him, because youve seen only him and Caliban. Foolish girl, to most people this man looks like a Caliban, and compared to him, most people look like angels.
response: My affectionsAre then most humble.

instruction: Sir Baptista, will you really act so unnaturally? I'm sorry that our good will towards Bianca should cause her grief.
response: Why will you mew her up,Signior Baptista, for this fiend of hellAnd make her bear the penance of her tongue?

instruction: [To SECOND SERVINGMAN] Fetch logs that are drier. Call Peter. Hell show you where they are.
response: I have a head, sir, that will find out logs, And never trouble Peter for the matter.

instruction: You hardly have the heart to tell me, so you must not have the heart to do it. Besides, my friends, have I offended you?
response: Offended us you have not, but the king.

instruction: Welcome home, Grumio.
response: How now, Grumio?

instruction: Yes, right, a verse from Horace. You've got it. [To himself] Ha, what an ass! This is no jokethe old man knows that they're guilty, and sends them weapons wrapped with words that wound them, although they don't pick up on it. But if our sly empress were here, she would applaud Andronicus's cleverness. But we'll leave her be for a while, since she's unwell.[To CHIRON and DEMETRIUS] And now, young lordswasn't it lucky that we came to Rome, since we arrived as foreigners and captives and now have so much power? It pleased me to have a go at Marcus Andronicus at the palace gate in front of his brother.
response: But me more good, to see so great a lordBasely insinuate and send us gifts.

instruction: How can that be?
response: Marry, sir, they praise me and make an ass of me, now my foes tell me plainly I am an ass.

instruction: Take a look at the badges they wear indicating for whom they work, then tell me if they are honest. This ugly monster [He points at CALIBAN] had a mother who was a witch so powerful that she could control the moon and the tides. These three have stolen from me. And this half-devilonly half-devil because he's a bastardplotted with them to kill me. You must recognize two of these men, and accept responsibility for them. I admit that this dark monster is mine.
response: I shall be pinched to death.

instruction: Sir, if I thought that I was actually awake, Id try to tell you. We were fast asleep andwe dont know howwe were below decks, when we heard all these different, strange noises: roaring, shrieking, howling, jingling chains, and more. All of these noises were so horrible that they woke us up. Immediately we were free, and we saw our courageous ship. The master danced with joy when he saw it. An instant later, as if in a dream, we were separated from the others and brought here in a daze.
response: [aside to PROSPERO] Was t well done?

instruction: Where have I been? The real question is, where are you? Master, has Tranio stolen your clothes? Or have you stolen his? Or both? Please tell me, what's going on?
response: Sirrah, come hither: tis no time to jest, And therefore frame your manners to the time.

instruction: His ship is strongly put together, and the captain is an expert. Therefore I have hope that he will be okay, and haven't resigned myself to thinking he's dead.
response: [within] A sail, a sail, a sail!

instruction: Let me live here forever. Such a wonderful father-in-law and wife make this place a paradise.
response: Sweet now, silence.

instruction: If he will pay the price. But for that
response: [Reciting to himself] 'When we for recompense have praised the vile, It stains the glory in that happy verse Which aptly sings the good.'

instruction: Say your prayers, now.
response: What mean you?

instruction: Well, come again tomorrow. Farewell. A devil who wore your face could lead my soul to hell.
response: Gentleman, God save thee.

instruction: Oh, brother Montague, give me your hand. This handshake is my daughters dowry. I can ask you for nothing more.
response: But I can give thee more, For I will raise her statue in pure gold, That whiles Verona by that name is known, There shall no figure at such rate be set As that of true and faithful Juliet.

instruction: Tell her that the King, who has the power to command, instead begs her
response: That, at her hands, which the kings King forbids.

instruction: Prince Pericles
response: That would be son to great Antiochus.

instruction: Im willing to resign my crown, but my sadness is still mine: you may take my crown and my kingdom from me, but not my sadness: Im still king of that.
response: Part of your cares you give me with your crown.

instruction: He won't spare anyone.
response: Good morrow to thee, gentle Apemantus!

instruction: Stand by me, Lucius; don't be afraid of your aunt.
response: She loves thee, boy, too well to do thee harm.

instruction: Oh, welcome, father! Father, can I respectfully ask you to explain (though we recently wanted to hide it, the time is now ripe to reveal it) what you know has happened between this youth and me?
response: A contract of eternal bond of love, Confirmed by mutual joinder of your hands, Attested by the holy close of lips, Strengthened by interchangement of your rings, And all the ceremony of this compact Sealed in my function, by my testimony, S

instruction: Oh good Sir Toby, stop! Here come the officers.
response: [t o ANTONIO ] Ill be with you anon.

instruction: And what will you do with him, Tranio?
response: If he be credulous and trust my tale, Ill make him glad to seem Vincentio And give assurance to Baptista Minola As if he were the right Vincentio.

instruction: Oh my, lieutenant! What villains have done this?
response: I think that one of them is hereabout,And cannot make away.

instruction: Her silence mocks me, and I'll get my revenge on her.
response: What, in my sight?Bianca, get thee in.

instruction: My father, the king, left me in Tarsus until the king, Cleon, and his evil wife tried to murder me. They had even hired a criminal to do it, but right as he was about to, a group of pirates came and rescued me and brought me to Mytilene. [PERICLES begins to cry] Sir, did I say something wrong? Why are you crying? Maybe you think I'm a fake, but I'm not: I'm good King Pericles's daughter, if good King Pericles is still alive.
response: Ho, Helicanus!

instruction: Did God create in you a beautiful blank slate just to write "whore" on it? What sin did you commit? Commit? Oh, you public prostitute! If I even spoke of what you did, my mouth would burn up modesty itself just by uttering the words. What sin have you committed? Heaven and the moon itself, the wind and the depths of the earth all turn away and don't want to hear about it. What sin have you committed? You shameless whore!
response: By heaven, you do me wrong!

instruction: I don't think there is any such woman who would do it.
response: Yes, a dozen, and as many to th' vantage as would storethe world they played for.

instruction: Don't worry, Baptista, we will satisfy you. You'll see. But I will go inside and get some revenge for this villainy.
response: And I, to sound the depth of this knavery.

instruction: I have already.
response: That was in thy rage.

instruction: Amen, my lady.
response: I will go seek him.Cassio, walk hereabout.

instruction: Calm down Titus.
response: My lord, here is my bill.

instruction: I agree with you completely, your Highness. I said those things to give these gentlemen a good time, since they have such strong lungs that they so often use to laugh at meaningless trivialities.
response: 'Twas you we laughed at.

instruction: "If not, just keep acting like a servant."
response: Why, this is very midsummer madness.

instruction: [Singing]The poor soul sat sighing by a sycamore tree,Everyone sing a green willow.With her hand on her chest and her head on her knee,Sing willow, willow, willow.The fresh streams ran by her, and murmured along with her moans,Sing willow, willow, willow.Her salt tears fell from her, and softened the stones,Sing willow, willow, willowPut these things down over there, Emilia.[Singing]Willow, willowPlease, hurry up, he'll come any minute now.[Singing]Everyone sing a green willow must be my garland.Let nobody blame him, I approve of his scornNo, that's not the next line. Listen! Who is that knocking at the door?
response: Its the wind.

instruction: But since you came too late to see the execution as we intended, at least bear witness t our good intentions. And so, my good Lord Mayor, we bid you farewell.
response: Go, after, after, cousin Buckingham.

instruction: To the platform, gentlemen. Come on, let's take up our posts for tonight's guard.
response: You see this fellow that is gone before, He is a soldier fit to stand by Caesar And give direction.

instruction: Then he must have found it. I never gave it to him. Send for him to come here, and let him tell you the truth.
response: He hath confessed.

instruction: Great to no one but those like yourself, and you but to Timon.
response: The senators of Athens greet thee, Timon.

instruction: Give up this attempt, and save your souls. Which of you, if you were in my positiona prince's son in prison, and two murderers like yourselves came to youwouldn't beg for your life? Yes, you would beg, if you were in my situation.
response: Relent?

instruction: Where is kind Hastings?
response: A flourish, trumpets!

instruction: Madam!
response: Will it be ever thus?

instruction: [Whispering] Didn't I say he would figure it out? This dog is excellent at tracking.
response: M.

instruction: I say, my lord, that if I were a man, these slaves wouldnt be safe in their mothers bedroom.
response: Ay, that's my boy!

instruction: Yes.
response: And he wears jewels now of Timon's gift,For which I wait for money.

instruction: [To GREGORY so that only he can hear] Will the law be on our side if I say yes?
response: [Aside to SAMPSON] No.

instruction: [Whispering] What a dish of poison she's prepared for him!
response: ( aside ) And with what wing the staniel checks at it!

instruction: My lord, whoever ends up journeying to meet the prince, for God's sake let us be part of the group. Along the way I'll create an opportunity to separate him from the queen's proud relativesas the first step in the plan we discussed recently.
response: My other self, my councils consistory, My oracle, my prophet, my dear cousin, I, as a child, will go by thy direction Toward Ludlow then, for well not stay behind.

instruction: Be nearby, since I might mess this up.
response: Here, at thy hand.

instruction: How? Has a donkey broken down the wall, so you find yourself outside the city?
response: Yonder comes a poet and a painter: the plague of company light upon thee!

instruction: By my god, I swear to you that I will.
response: First know thou, I begot him on the empress.

instruction: Brave son of great Andronicuswhose name once terrorized us and now comforts us, and whose honorable service to Rome has been badly repaidyou can count on us. We'll go where you lead us, like stinging bees led by the beekeeper to a field of flowers, and take revenge on cursed Tamora.
response: And as he saith, so say we all with him.

instruction: Hey, Brabantio! Sir Brabantio, hey!
response: Awake!

instruction: Yes, him, woman. I said "your husband"do you understand the words? My friend, your husband, the honest, honest Iago.
response: If he say so, may his pernicious soul Rot half a grain a day!

instruction: Yes, my good lord: he owes five talents, and even though he has such a small income, his creditors are insistent that he give it back right away. He wants a letter from you to those who have imprisoned him, without which he claims he'll have no comfort.
response: Noble Ventidius!

instruction: Indeed, your nephews were cheated by their uncle of their comfort, kingdom, relatives, freedom, and life. Some other hand might have pierced their tender hearts, but you're the one who gave the order. No doubt the murderous knife was dull and blunt until it was sharpened against your hard heart of stone, and after that it could rejoice among my little lambs' bloody innards. But constant talk of grief makes wild grief tame, so I won't say my boys' names again until I've anchored my fingernails in your eyes and gouged them out. I am like a poor boat without sails in a stormy bay of death, and I'll break myself to pieces against your rocky heart.
