response: Madam, so thrive I in my enterprise And dangerous success of bloody wars As I intend more good to you and yours Than ever you or yours were by me harmed!

instruction: How is my Kate doing? What, sweetheart, why so dejected?
response: Mistress, what cheer?

instruction: Alas! But for whose sake did I do that terrible deed? For my brother Edward, for his sake. He can't be sending you to murder me for the prince's deathbecause in that, he is just as guilty as I am. If God intends to punish me for this deed, oh, you know that he will do it publicly! God has no need for indirect or illegal methods of killing those who have offended him.
response: Who made thee then a bloody ministerWhen gallant-springing, brave Plantagenet, That princely novice, was struck dead by thee?

instruction: Go, some of you, and get a mirror.
response: Read o'er this paper while the glass doth come.

instruction: You disobedient wretch of a worthless girl! Ill tell you what: get yourself to church on Thursday or never again look me in the face. Dont speak. Dont reply. Dont answer me. [JULIET rises] My fingers itch to slap you. Wife, we never thought we had been blessed that God gave us just this one child, but now I see that this one is one too many. We were cursed when we had her. She sickens me, the good-for-nothing.
response: God in heaven bless her!You are to blame, my lord, to rate her so.

instruction: Indeed, but you will be, and here's my hand. [He offers her his hand]
response: [taking his hand] Now, sir, thought is free.

instruction: She says that your dog is badly-behaved. And she tells you that a snide "thanks" is good enough for a present like that.
response: But she received my dog?

instruction: What do you mean, sir?
response: To beg of you, kind friends, this coat of worth, For it was sometime target to a king; I know it by this mark.

instruction: Oh, devil, devil! If the whole world were filled with the tears of women, they'd all be fake tears! Get out of my sight!
response: I will not stay to offend you.

instruction: I remember that face well, though the last time I saw it it was blackened by the smoke of war. He was the captain of a small, flimsy ship, worthless because of its sizebut with that pitiful boat he fought such a damaging battle against my fleet's most noble warship that we had to admire him even in our bitter defeat.[To the officer] What's going on here?
response: Orsino, this is that Antonio That took the Phoenix and her fraught from Candy, And this is he that did the Tiger board When your young nephew Titus lost his leg.

instruction: What, are trying to make a fool of me?
response: I will prove it legitimate, sir, upon the oaths of judgment and reason.

instruction: Give me a moment to breathe, dear lord, a pause before I make a statement. I'll give you my answer shortly.
response: [aside to the other attendants] The king is angry.

instruction: If you consider that a joke, then the rest was too.
response: Why, how now, dame!

instruction: Did you hear that, Petruchio? She says she'll see you hanged first.
response: Is this your speeding?

instruction: Really?
response: Indeed?

instruction: May God and your swords be praised, victorious friends! The day is ours. The bloody dog is dead.
response: [offering him the crown] Courageous Richmond, well hast thou acquit thee.

instruction: No, Ill bite my thumb at them. Thats an insult, and theyll be disgraced if they dont react. [He bites his thumb]
response: Do you bite your thumb at us, sir?

instruction: Her honor belongs to her, too. Can she give that away, as well?
response: Her honor is an essence thats not seen,They have it very oft that have it not.But for the handkerchief

instruction: Poison never fell onto a fouler toad. Get out of my sight! You're infecting my eyes.
response: Thine eyes, sweet lady, have infected mine.

instruction: Then it's certain that they are going for Cyprus. Is Marcus Luccicos not in town?
response: Hes now in Florence.

instruction: You are too arrogant, Apemantus.
response: Of nothing so much as that I am not like Timon.

instruction: I won't say a word; I'll be perfectly polite. Come on, start the music!
response: Pray, good shepherd, what fair swain is thisWhich dances with your daughter?

instruction: It's good, sir, that you hunted for yourself. There's a rumor that your deer has faced you down and cornered you.
response: Oh, Oh, Petruchio!

instruction: Make him your lieutenant, please. He can barely stand up straight, much less hold a flag.
response: Well not run, Monsieur Monster.

instruction: Father, have pity on him. Ill be the guarantee of his goodness.
response: Silence!

instruction: You say you dont know what Juliet wants. Thats a treacherous road. I dont like it.
response: Immoderately she weeps for Tybalts death, And therefore have I little talked of love, For Venus smiles not in a house of tears.

instruction: [Giving the letter to FABIAN] You read it, sir.
response: [reads] By the Lord, madam, you wrong me, and the world shall know it.

instruction: I will then, sir. And as for what I promised you, I'll be as good as my word. He is easy to ride, and responds well to the reins.
response: This is the man.

instruction: Stop, Toby! I command you to stop!
response: Madam!

instruction: He may command me as my king, but you still have power over me as my relative.
response: I pray you, uncle, give me this dagger.

instruction: I know one unhappy gentleman whose empty wallet doesn't match his proud spirit. Gold is better than twenty speeches, and will, no doubt, tempt him to do anything.
response: What is his name?

instruction: Great Timon
response: Of none but such as you, and you of Timon.

instruction: We will descend and embrace him. Cousin of Hereford, if your cause is just, may you be victorious in this royal fight! Farewell, my blood; if that blood is shed today, we'll lament it, but we won't take revenge.
response: O let no noble eye profane a tear For me, if I be gored with Mowbray's spear: As confident as is the falcon's flight Against a bird, do I with Mowbray fight.

instruction: Give him my regards. I will send his ransom and when he is free I will ask him to come to me. It is not enough simply to help the weak stand. One must also support them after helping them up. Farewell.
response: All happiness to your honour!

instruction: Ill protect you from that word by using the cure for adversityphilosophywhich will comfort you even though youve been banished.
response: Yet banishèd?

instruction: Should we take that to mean that you've slipped up since then?
response: O my most sacred lady!

instruction: Hello, sir, what do you want?
response: Get on your cloak, and haste you to Lord Timon; Importune him for my moneys; be not ceased With slight denial, nor then silenced when 'Commend me to your master'and the cap Plays in the right hand, thus: but tell him, My uses cry to me, I m

instruction: [To the PRINCE] My lord, would you like to continue on? My good cousin Buckingham and I will go to your mother and ask her to meet you at the Tower.
response: [to PRINCE] What, will you go unto the Tower, my lord?

instruction: The plantain leaf is excellent for that.
response: For what, I pray thee?

instruction: Look, he's coming here.
response: I will not leave him now till CassioBe called to him.How is t with you, my lord?

instruction: Calm down, siras bad as this is.
response: Now, mild may be thy life!

instruction: Father, and wife, and gentlemenfarewell. I'm off to Venice. Sunday is coming soon. We will have rings, and things, and fine clothes, and kiss me, Kate. We will be married on Sunday.
response: Was ever match clapped up so suddenly?

instruction: I wish all the world but him would reject her, so she'd have only that poor schoolteacher to accept her as a wife! But as for me, I will surely keep my promise. I plan to marry a wealthy widow before three days have passed. She's been in love with me for as long as I've been pursuing this proud, disdainful vixen. And so farewell, Sir Lucentio. From now on, kindness in women, not their beauty, will win my love. And so I bid you farewell, and am resolved to keep my promise.
response: Mistress Bianca, bless you with such grace As 'longeth to a lovers blessèd case!

instruction: Oh, so you're not the boss of her?
response: From all dishonesty he can: in this,Unless he take the course that you have done,Commit me for committing honour, trust it,He shall not rule me.

instruction: Look: the midwife, Mrs. Rumor, signed her name to prove it, along with five or six eyewitnesses. Why would I sell lies?
response: Pray you now, buy it.

instruction: Oh God!
response: I'll force thee yield to my desire.

instruction: [To QUEEN ELIZABETH] Good day to you, your royal Grace.
response: God make your Majesty joyful, as you have been.

instruction: No, my good lord; but Pluto says that you will have revenge from hell, if you ask for it. He thinks that Justice is busy with Jove in heaven, or somewhere else, so you need to wait a bit.
response: He doth me wrong to feed me with delays.

instruction: I believe you. Please, look at me. You remind me of someone . . . where are you from? From this country?
response: No, nor of any shores:Yet I was mortally brought forth, and amNo other than I appear.

instruction: But Clarence died by your first order, the poor man. The death sentence must have been carried by Mercury, the winged messenger god, while the counter-order was carried by some slow cripple. It arrived too late even for his burial. It seems that someone less noble and less loyalnearer in bloody thoughts but not a blood relationdeserves the punishment that poor Clarence got, but instead goes free without suspicion.
response: [kneeling] A boon, my sovereign, for my service done.

instruction: Well, they listened to me as closely as they would to their own father's will being read. There was a Spanish guy whose mouth watered so much, he went to masturbate off just the description of her.
response: We shall have him here to-morrow with his best ruff on.

instruction: Then patiently listen to my impatience.
response: Madam, I have a touch of your condition,Which cannot brook the accent of reproof.

instruction: Let me speak a little. This youth that you see hereI snatched him from the jaws of death and nursed him back to health with tenderness and love, and I thought that he seemed so noble and worthy that I totally devoted myself to him.
response: Whats that to us?

instruction: You holy clergymen, cant we do something to rid the kingdom of him?
response: My lord, Before I freely speak my mind herein, You shall not only take the sacrament To bury mine intents, but also to effect Whatever I shall happen to devise.

instruction: Do you want to hear it again?
response: No, for I hold him to be unworthy of his place that does those things.

instruction: No, and he didn't look at us.
response: See, she will speak to him.

instruction: Oh, dont touch me. Im not Stephano, Im just a cramp on two legs.
response: Youd be king o' th' isle, sirrah?

instruction: No, I joke because I'm mocking my own misery: since you have tried to kill my family name by banishing my son, I mock my name to flatter you.
response: Should dying men flatter with those that live?

instruction: Well, dont swear. Although you bring me joy, I cant take joy in this exchange of promises tonight. Its too wild, thoughtless, sudden. Its too much like lightning, which disappears before you can even say, its lightning. My love, good night. Our love, which now is like a flower bud, may blossom in the summer air into a beautiful flower by the next time we meet. Good night! I hope you feel in your heart the same sweet calm and rest that I feel in mine.
response: O, wilt thou leave me so unsatisfied?

instruction: Have you done everything possible to get him to explain?
response: Both by myself and many other friends.

instruction: Yes, sir.
response: And not a jot of Tranio in your mouth.

instruction: I did say that what I first created the storm at sea. Tell me, my spirit, how are the king and his followers?
response: Confined together In the same fashion as you gave in charge, Just as you left them, all prisoners, sir, In the line grove which weather-fends your cell.

instruction: [To himself] These are handsome beings, if theyre not spirits. That one's a noble god, who carries liquor from the heavens. I'll bow down before him.
response: [to TRINCULO] How didst thou scape?

instruction: None in fact. Except when the northeast wind blew bitterly against our faces, making our eyes water.
response: What said our cousin when you parted with him?

instruction: Not only Lucius's Servant, but Philotus's too!
response: Good day at once.

instruction: A cunning boy! Get out of here, you're too clever for your own good.
response: Good madam, be not angry with the child.

instruction: It's unthinkable!
response: She makes our profession as it were to stink aforethe face of the gods.

instruction: Sir, you know your father has a temper. He doesn't want to hear from you right now, so I don't suggest you try it. He probably doesn't want to see you, either. Stay away from him until his anger dies down.
response: I not purpose it.I think, Camillo?

instruction: If you want, my lord, there are certain ladies who would like to come in.
response: Ladies!

instruction: And the third?
response: The third of Antioch;And his device, a wreath of chivalry;The word, 'Me pompae provexit apex.'

instruction: Only everything I haveyes, including myself. That's what I'll give to a child of yours. May Lethe drown your sad memories of the wrongs you imagine I've done to you.
response: Be brief, lest that the process of thy kindness Last longer telling than thy kindness' date.

instruction: The morning smiles as it replaces frowning night, and streaks light across the clouds in the east. Darkness staggers away from the suns path like a drunkard. Now, before the sun rises, bringing on the day and drying the dew, I must fill my basket with poisonous weeds and the precious nectar of flowers. The earth is both natures mother and its tomb. Plants arise from the earth as from a womb, and when they die, they are buried in the earth. Many different plants and animals come from the earths womb. All of these children find nourishment from the earth, and all have some special, unique virtue. There is a power that resides in herbs, plants, and stones. For theres nothing on earth thats so evil that it does not also provide the earth with some kind of good. Nor is there anything so good that it cant be turned bad if its abused and used incorrectly. Virtue, when misused, turns to vice, while vice can sometimes become virtue through proper action.
response: Within the infant rind of this small flower Poison hath residence and medicine power.

instruction: But sir, here comes your boy. He needs to learn his lines.
response: [as LUCENTIO] Fear you not him.Sirrah Biondello,Now do your duty throughly, I advise you.Imagine twere the right Vincentio.

instruction: [Kneeling] I must ask you a favor in return for the service I've done for you, my king.
response: I prithee, peace.

instruction: Oh, my dear Cassio! My sweet Cassio! Oh, Cassio, Cassio, Cassio!
response: O notable strumpet!

instruction: Our mother will be forever shamed by this.
response: Rome will despise her for this foul escape.

instruction: As long as they haven't actually done anything, it's just a pardonable sin. But, if I give my wife a handkerchief . . .
response: What then?

instruction: What, stuff from a house?
response: It is a kind of history.

instruction: You mean to bear me, not to bear with me.
response: [aside] With what a sharp-provided wit he reasons!

instruction: Then, as I was saying: the duke rode through the streets on a royal horse while everyone cried God save you, Bolingbroke! You would have thought the windows themselves were speaking, since so many people, young and old, leaned out their windows to get a look at him, and that the walls were crying out Jesus preserve you! Welcome, Bolingbroke! Meanwhile, he turned his head from one to the other, taking his hat off and speaking to them like this: I thank you, countrymen. And doing that, he went on his way.
response: Alack, poor Richard!

instruction: [AUTOLYCUS takes the shepherd's son's wallet out of his pocket without him noticing] Carefully, my friend, very carefully . . . [The shepherd's son lifts AUTOLYCUS to his feet] You've really helped me out.
response: Dost lack any money?

instruction: [To SEBASTIAN] Goodness, he just talks and talks and talks!
response: [to GONZALO] I prithee, spare.

instruction: I might describe him as a god, because Ive never seen anything on earth that looked so noble.
response: [aside] It goes on, I see,As my soul prompts it.

instruction: Then I think tomorrow should be a favorable day.
response: Who knows the Lord Protectors mind herein?Who is most inward with the noble duke?

instruction: Excellent.
response: Give me thy hand.

instruction: God forbid that we should threaten our lord the king with such violence! Your noble cousin Henry Bolingbroke humbly kisses your hand, swearing by the honorable tomb of your royal grandfatherand by the royal blood that runs in both your veins, and by the hands of his father Gauntthat he comes here only to reclaim his righful property and to beg on his knees that you take back his banishment. Once he has that, he will let his glittering sword rust away, confining his horses to their stables and his heart to the faithful service of your majesty. As a prince, his word is good; as I am a gentleman, I believe him.
response: Northumberland, say thus the king returns: His noble cousin is right welcome hither; And all the number of his fair demands Shall be accomplish'd without contradiction: With all the gracious utterance thou hast Speak to his gentle hearing k

instruction: Ha, ha! Publius, Publius, what have you done? See, see, you've shot off one of Taurus's horns.
response: This was the sport, my lord: when Publius shot, The Bull, being gall'd, gave Aries such a knock That down fell both the Ram's horns in the court; And who should find them but the empress' villain?

instruction: Who's she?
response: A virtuous maid, the daughter of a count That died some twelvemonth since, then leaving her In the protection of his son, her brother, Who shortly also died, for whose dear love, They say, she hath abjured the company And sight of men.

instruction: The Slys aren't villains, you whore. Look it upwe came over with Richard the Conqueror. So hold your tongue, and forget about it. Enough!

instruction: Boult, what are her assets?
response: She has a good face, speaks well, and has excellentgood clothes: there's no further necessity ofqualities can make her be refused.

instruction: Ah, now I can tell that you're as dumb as Timon.
response: May these add to the number that may scald thee!

instruction: Am I a gentleman?
response: If not, let me see thee a servant still.

instruction: If you got what you deserved, you would be taught to show some respect.
response: To serve me well, you all should do me duty: Teach me to be your queen, and you my subjects.O, serve me well, and teach yourselves that duty!

instruction: And here's my coat.
response: Let's make no stay.

instruction: Some honest Christian give me another gage, so that I can throw it down and show that Norfolk lies:[throws down gage] I throw this down, so that if he comes back I can challenge him in battle.

instruction: Yes, yes. I don't care about virtuous living.
response: [sings] O mistress mine, where are you roaming?

instruction: But look what heaven can do! At one time, the earth, sea, and air were hardly enough to content and please our mouths, though they gave us all the food we needed to survive. Just as houses become run-down from lack of use, our mouths are now starved for lack of exercise. Two years ago we looked for the best recipes to please our palates; now we'd be happy to get a crust a bread, and beg for it. Women who once happily nursed their babies would hardly think it strange that they would now want to eat them. Hunger is such a grim reality that husbands and wives take bets on which of them will die first. Look, there's a man, and there's a woman crying. Here so many are sick that, even when someone dies, no one has the strength to bury them. Isn't this true?
response: Our cheeks and hollow eyes do witness it.

instruction: You speak the truth. I won't marry again, since there's no one else like Hermione. If I married someone less wonderful than Hermione, yet treated that second wife better than I treated my first, I can only imagine Hermione's ghost would possess her body and come back to haunt me, asking "Why are you doing this to me?"
response: Had she such power,She had just cause.

instruction: Give me my heart back again; I cant be responsible for killing your heart. So, now I have my heart again, be gone, so that I can kill it with a groan.

instruction: Close the garden door and let me be alone to hear this message.

instruction: Hey, what is the matter? Who is it that cried out?

instruction: Look here, it is true! You uniquely honest man, take this. The gods have given you a gift out of my misery. [Offering FLAVIUS gold] Go be rich and happy, but under one condition: you take advantage of other men, hate all of them, curse all of them, and show charity to none of them. Let the starving flesh slide off the bones of a beggar before you give him any money. Give to dogs what you do not give to men, whom you should let go to prison in debt. Let men be like dying woods, with diseases eating at their lying blood. Live this way, and goodbye.
response: O, let me stay,And comfort you, my master.

instruction: Grumio, my friend!
response: How now, old lad?

response: Well, well see t.

instruction: [To herself] Yes, and in killing my husband and son, you spent much better blood than yours or your brother's.

response: Oh yes, I saw sweet beauty in her face Such as the daughter of Agenor had, That made great Jove to humble him to her hand When with his knees he kissed the Cretan strand.

instruction: And what did the young man say?
response: His answer was, he would unto the stews, And from the common'st creature pluck a glove, And wear it as a favour; and with that He would unhorse the lustiest challenger.

instruction: It is no lie, sir. Its the truth. And what I said, I said to my face.
response: Thy face is mine, and thou hast slandered it.

instruction: What marvelous, beautiful music!
response: Give us kind keepers, heavens!

instruction: You or any man may get drunk now and then. I'll tell you what to do. Our general's wife is now the one who's actually in charge. What I mean by this is that he is totally devoted to her and obsessed with contemplating and describing her qualities and graces. Apologize to her, and beg her to help you regain your place as lieutenant. She is noble, kind, clever, and blessed. She thinks it is wrong not to do as she is asked. Ask her to help mend your relationship with her husband, andI'll bet anything on itthe friendship between Othello and you will grow stronger now than ever before.
response: You advise me well.

response: I shall not sleep in quiet at the Tower.

instruction: Say your father sent you to greet him and to bring him gifts. I'll write down some instructions for how to behave toward him and will pack all the gifts you'll deliver on your father's behalf. All of it will support your story: that you've come to make peace between him and your father.
response: I am bound to you:There is some sap in this.

instruction: Sirs, take up the corpse.
response: Towards Chertsey, noble lord?

instruction: I dreamed that I had broken out of the Tower and was on a ship to France, and my brother Richard was with me. He persuaded me to leave my cabin and walk on the boat's deck with him. From there we looked toward England and reminisced about our many frightening experiences during the wars between the Yorks and the Lancasters. As we paced along the boards of the deck, Richard seemed to stumble, and as I tried to grab him he knocked me overboard into the rolling waves. Oh Lord, how painful it was to drownwith the dreadful noise of water in my ears and the ugly visions of death in my eyes. I seemed to see a thousand shipwrecks; ten thousand men whose bodies had been gnawed by fish; bars of gold; huge anchors; heaps of pearls; and vast amounts of priceless jewels, all scattered on the bottom of the sea. Some of the jewels lay inside of dead men's skulls. And they had crept into their empty eye socketsso that they looked like false eyes. The gems reflected the slimy bottom of the ocean floor, and mocked the dead bones that lay scattered around.
response: Had you such leisure in the time of death To gaze upon the secrets of the deep?

instruction: Mistress, what do you mean by that?
response: Thus I conceive by him.

instruction: My husband!
response: What needs this iterance, woman?

instruction: Welcome, dear nephew, ruler of my thoughts. It seems that the tiring journey has made you sad.
response: No, uncle, but our crosses on the way Have made it tedious, wearisome, and heavy.I want more uncles here to welcome me.

instruction: I have some business with the king, sir.

instruction: He's always drunk before going to bed. He can't sleep unless he's had something to drink.

instruction: May the gods protect you!
response: For me, be you thoughten That I came with no ill intent; for to me The very doors and windows savour vilely.

instruction: My lord, it's nothing so good that it will please you to hear it, but nothing so bad that I can't report it.

response: Where my stomach finds meat; or, rather, where I eatit.

response: Valentine!

instruction: These words do the person who speaks them justice.
response: And enter in our ears like great triumphersIn their applauding gates.

instruction: Please, he has been putting me off every day for the past month. Please, my master is newly aware of reasons to want his money back, and only asks that your honor will prove consistent and give him what you owe.

instruction: No; his ears are filled with other sounds, like flattering praise from his hangers-on (which the young are always happy to hear) and reports of Italian fashions (which our country still shamefully attempts to imitate). When is there some new vanity in the worldfor it's novelty that matters to him, not moralitythat isn't quickly buzzed into his ears? Then advice comes all too late, since his desires are stronger than his willpower. Don't give advice to him, since he only does what he wants: you're already short of breath, so don't waste it on him.

instruction: But he's too like the father to ever be good. First hang the child so he can see it die, which is a sight that will distress a father's soul. Get me a ladder.

Sometimes you would call out for Cicely Hacket.

instruction: Well said, Hermione.

response: O, go to.

instruction: What should I swear by?

instruction: [Singing]Come now, come now death,And let me be laid in a cypress coffin.Fly away, fly away breath,I've been killed by a fair, cruel girl.My shroud of white, adorned with yew sprigs,Oh, prepare it for me!No one as faithful as IHas ever died like me.Throw no flowers, no sweet flowersUpon my black coffin.Let no friends, no friends seeMy poor corpse, or my scattered bones.Save your thousand sighs of mourning,And bury me, Oh, whereNo sad true lovers can find my grave,To weep there!

instruction: Thank you. Im extremely tired. [He falls asleep]

instruction: What a fuss of bows and butts sticking out, here! I wonder whether their bows are worth the money that you pay for them. Friendship is full of worthless people, and such false people should not have good legs, so that true fools do not give all their wealth for a few curtsies.

instruction: It seemed like I did. And I often tried to die, but the jealous waves kept my soul bottled up inside of me, and wouldn't let it go free to find the empty, wandering air. The water kept my soul smothered inside my panting body until I almost burst open.
response: Awaked you not in this sore agony?

instruction: Why?
response: [Aside] That such an ass should owe them.

instruction: Previously, you filled your days by using your own power unchecked, making your own personal desires equivalent with justice. Before now I and people like me slept in the shadow of your power, walking about with folded arms and voicing our opinions only in vain. Now is the time for action, when the bones of those bowing down to you finally cry out, "No more!" Now those supposed wrongdoers, voiceless then, will have the opportunity to sit in your positions of power. And those who were supposedly ill-mannered during your time shall be able to say and do whatever they like.
response: Noble and young, When thy first griefs were but a mere conceit, Ere thou hadst power or we had cause of fear, We sent to thee, to give thy rages balm, To wipe out our ingratitude with loves Above their quantity.

instruction: Where is Cesario going?
response: After him I love More than I love these eyes, more than my life, More, by all mores, than e'er I shall love wife.

instruction: Brother, Ill go and bring it to you.
response: Now must I to the monument alone.

instruction: No more of this drowning nonsense, you hear?
response: I am changed.

instruction: Well, this is what happens when men are ruled by women. It isn't the king who's sending you to the Towerit's his wife, Lady Elizabeth Grey. She's the one who persuaded him to take such an extreme action. Didn't she and her brother, Anthony Woodeville, make the king send Lord Hastings to the Tower? He was released only today. We are not safe, Clarence. We are not safe.
response: By heaven, I think there is no man is secure But the queens kindred and night-walking heralds That trudge betwixt the king and Mistress Shore.

instruction: Oh, please, I beg you, dont work so hard. I wish the lightning had burned up these logs that youve been commanded to stack in a pile! Please, put the log down and rest. When this wood burns, it will cry because it made you tired. My father is hard at work studying. So please, rest. Were safe from my father for the next three hours.
response: O most dear mistress,The sun will set before I shall dischargeWhat I must strive to do.

instruction: I am all of my father's daughters, and all of his sons tooand yet I'm not certain of that. Sir, should I go see this lady then?
response: Ay, thats the theme.To her in haste.

instruction: A pimp! A pimp! A pimp! Thats it!
response: What hast thou found?

instruction: No, pursue him now, before he exposes the prank and it gets ruined.
response: Why, we shall make him mad indeed.

instruction: [To DORCAS] We can both sing it.[To AUTOLYCUS] If you'll take a part, we can do it, since it has three parts.
response: We had the tune on't a month ago.

instruction: Your servant and your friend. One that is waiting to hear your Ladyship's order.
response: Sir Eglamour, a thousand times good morrow.

instruction: Its not any earlier, I tell you. The lusty hand of the clock is now upon the prick of noon.
response: Out upon you!

instruction: Then my lips now have the sin they took from yours.
response: Sin from thy lips?

instruction: Yes; please, sing.
response: [sings] Come away, come away, death, And in sad cypress let me be laid.

instruction: A very mean meaning.
response: Right, I mean you.

instruction: I promise you, Im not. I wouldn't risk my reputation for self-control for such a tiny thing. Will you laugh me to sleep? For Im feeling very tired.
response: Go sleep, and hear us.

instruction: [As LUCENTIO] Sir, who are you that you would presume to beat my servant?
response: What am I, sir!

instruction: A blessed labor, my sovereign lord. If any among this princely group considers me an enemywhether from lies they've heard about me, or because by accident or in anger I've done something to give offenseI want us to be reconciled and become peaceful friends. To be enemies with anyone is like death to me; I hate it, and only desire the love of all good men.
response: A holy day shall this be kept hereafter.

instruction: What, for being a Puritan? And what's your far-fetched reason for that, dear knight?
response: I have no exquisite reason for t, but I have reason good enough.

instruction: Oh, you stupid Moor! I found the handkerchief you speak of by chance, and gave it to my husband. For he often eagerly and earnestly begged me to steal it. He was more concerned about it than one would expect for such a little thing.
response: Villainous whore!

instruction: Not yet.
response: I wonder on't; he was wont to shine at seven.

instruction: Stop bothering him. You will find him this way again.
response: Come not to me again: but say to Athens, Timon hath made his everlasting mansion Upon the beached verge of the salt flood; Who once a day with his embossed froth The turbulent surge shall cover: thither come, And let my grave-stone be your

instruction: Do that, and tell my beloved to be ready to scold me.
response: Here, sir, a ring she bid me give you, sir.

instruction: Well done, sir.
response: Though I am satisfied and need no more Than what I know, yet shall the oracle Give rest to the minds of others, such as he Whose ignorant credulity will not Come up to the truth.

instruction: Yes, mistress, and Petruchio is the headmaster. He teaches suitable tricks to tame a shrew and her chattering tongue.
response: O master, master, I have watched so long That I am dog-weary, but at last I spied An ancient angel coming down the hill Will serve the turn.

instruction: Go, do what I say! Get out!
response: Beseech your highness, call the queen again.

instruction: Ceres, I am the messenger that carries the rainbow for Juno, the Queen of the Sky. She commands you to leave behind your rich farmlands of wheat, rye, barley, oats, and peas; the grassy hills where sheep graze and the meadows covered with hay for the sheep to eat in winter; your riverbanks covered in vines and branches that April, on your orders, covers with flowers for virginal nymphs to use to make crowns; your yellow-flowered groves where young men go when they have been rejected by their lovers; your pruned vineyards; your rocky seashore where you yourself fly. Leave all those places, and come to meet the Queen on this grassy spotthis very placeto come and play. The peacocks that draw her chariot approach at full speed.
response: Approach, rich Ceres, her to entertain.

instruction: Go on, I insist.
response: [Takes the money] This afternoon, sir?

instruction: [Whispering] He'll pick up the scent eventually, no matter how much it smells of a prank.
response: MMalvolio.

instruction: Why did he call you this?
response: I do not know.

instruction: Did you notice that?
response: He would not stay at your petitions: madeHis business more material.

instruction: Unbuckle, unbuckle.
response: Fortunate mistress,let my prophecy Come home to ye!

instruction: Just trying to redo what you have undone. I will do that much before I let you go.
response: Wert thou not banishèd on pain of death?

instruction: Rosalinethat pale-skinned, hard-hearted wenchtorments him so much that hes going to go insane.
response: Tybalt, the kinsman to old Capulet,Hath sent a letter to his fathers house.

instruction: That word "judgment" has made me feel a little bit guilty.
response: What, art thou afraid?

instruction: Oh, I am miserable and unhappy!
response: Unhappy were you, madam, ere I came;But by my coming I have made you happy.

instruction: That's what he said.
response: 'Have I no friend?' quoth he: he spake it twice,And urged it twice together, did he not?

instruction: That's heavy stuff! Heavy stuff! But lookee here, boy. Cross your heartyou came across the dying, and I came across something that's newborn. [He lifts Perdita's blanket out of the basket] Here's a sight for you: look, a blanket for a gentleman's baby! [He pulls out a bag of gold] Lookee here, pick it up now, pick it up, boy, and open it! So, let's see: I've got an idea the fairies have made me rich. This is a changelingopen it. What's it say, boy?
response: You're a made old man: if the sins of your youthare forgiven you, you're well to live.

instruction: [Standing up] Amen.
response: You cloudy princes and heart-sorrowing peers That bear this heavy mutual load of moan, Now cheer each other in each others love.

instruction: Oh yes, I saw the sweet beauty in her face, just like that of Europa, the daughter of Agenorbeauty that made even the great god Jove fall in love and humble himself, falling to his knees and kissing the ground on that beach in Crete.
response: Saw you no more?

instruction: How do you like this portrait, Apemantus?
response: The best, for the innocence.

instruction: Please stop.
response: Heavens, have I said, the bounty of this lord!

instruction: How are you, Cassio? What's going on with you?
response: Madam, my former suit.

instruction: Oh, my poor father! The spies have found us, and now we won't get to celebrate our wedding.
response: You are married?

instruction: Yes?
response: I call thee not.

instruction: Oh, nicely done, Lucius! Good boy, in Virgo's lap; give it to Pallas.
response: My lord, I aim a mile beyond the moon;Your letter is with Jupiter by this.

instruction: Oh, true, good Catesby. Tell him to gather the largest army he can in a hurry, and meet me at Salisbury right away.
response: I go.

instruction: I'll tell you about it later. Let's eat now.
response: This is the old man still.

instruction: I want to work among honest women.
response: 'Faith, my acquaintance lies little amongst them.

instruction: I trust you. Walk down to the sea; I'll follow you from behind.
response: We are blest in this man, as I may say, even blest.

instruction: But how did you want it to be made?
response: Marry, sir, with needle and thread.

instruction: But you'll still be hanged for being gone so long. Or at least fired and kicked out, and wouldn't that be just as bad for you?
response: Many a good hanging prevents a bad marriage, and, for turning away, let summer bear it out.

instruction: [To OLIVIA] Don't be shocked. His blood is pure and noble. If all this is true, as the two really seem to be brother and sister, then I too will share in the spoils of this lucky shipwreck. [To VIOLA] Boy, you've said to me a thousand times that you'd never love a woman like you love me.
response: And all those sayings will I overswear; And those swearings keep as true in soul As doth that orbèd continent the fire That severs day from night.

instruction: Okay. What, then?
response: One only daughter have I, no kin else, On whom I may confer what I have got: The maid is fair, o' the youngest for a bride, And I have bred her at my dearest cost In qualities of the best.

instruction: Never.
response: To fetch her fan, her gloves, her mask, nor nothing?

instruction: Do that, and in two days I will give you your freedom.
response: Thats my noble master!What shall I do?

instruction: What incredible thing will he do next as if it was nothing?
response: I think he will carry this island home in his pocket and give it his son for an apple.

instruction: No, heaven forbid! Gentlemen, give me some light so I can bind the wound with my shirt.
response: What is the matter, ho?

instruction: [Reads from an official document] Hermione, Queen of Sicily and wife of King Leontes: you are here accused and called to account for high treason, for committing adultery with Polixenes, King of Bohemia, and conspiring with Camillo to assassinate your husband the king. By nature of the circumstances, you are also charged with aiding and abetting the fugitives to their escape, which violates the trust and duty of a true subject.
response: Since what I am to say must be but that Which contradicts my accusation and The testimony on my part no other But what comes from myself, it shall scarce boot me To say 'not guilty:' mine integrity Being counted falsehood, shall, as I expre

instruction: I believe it, and would even believe it if an oracle said otherwise.
response: Then as my gift and thine own acquisition Worthily purchased, take my daughter.

instruction: [To JULIA] Is your name Sebastian? I like you, and so I'll give you a job to do soon.
response: In what you please: I'll do what I can.

instruction: Fight, sir? No, sir.
response: But if you do, sir, I am for you.

instruction: Padua can afford this pleasant lifestyle, my son Petruchio.
response: Padua affords nothing but what is kind.

instruction: [To the SHEPHERD] "Advocate" is court-speak for "pheasant;" say you don't have one.
response: None, sir; I have no pheasant, cock nor hen.

instruction: If she is unattractive, but has some wits, she'll find a man suitable for her appearance.
response: Worse and worse!

instruction: There's some kind of evil in the air. I'll have to be patient until this all clears up. Listen, everyone: unlike most women, I'm not one to cry, and the fact that I'm not shedding a tear might lead you not to pity me. But I promise you that my heart is hurting more right now than tears could show. I'm begging you, all of you, to think clearly, see me clearly, and help the king to do the right thing!
response: Shall I be heard?

instruction: [To himself] Simonides!
response: We would purge the land of these drones, that robthe bee of her honey.

instruction: I remember that Henry the Sixth prophesied that Richmond would be king one day, when Richmond was only a foolish boy. A king, perhaps
response: My lord

instruction: Oh, I had a miserable night last night. It was so full of ugly dreams and terrifying visions that I swear I wouldn't choose to spend another night like iteven if it bought me a lifetime of happy days.
response: What was your dream, my lord?

instruction: Two weeks and a few odd days.
response: Even or odd, of all days in the year, Come Lammas Eve at night shall she be fourteen.

instruction: I think I can find him, if you want to get some strong, armed men together and come along with me.
response: Pray you lead on.

instruction: You're mistaken, sir, you're mistaken. Please tell me, what do you think his name is?
response: His name!

instruction: You often scolded me for loving Rosaline.
response: For doting, not for loving, pupil mine.

instruction: Listen to me. Stop thinking about her.
response: O, teach me how I should forget to think!

instruction: It's been a while. How is everything in your world?
response: It wears, sir, as it grows.

instruction: Though the bad luck you've experienced has hurt you the most, we feel your pain, too.
response: O your sweet queen!That the strict fates had pleased you had brought her hither,To have bless'd mine eyes with her!

instruction: I'd love to know what happened next.
response: I make a broken delivery of the business; but the changes I perceived in the king and Camillo were very notes of admiration: they seemed almost, with staring on one another, to tear the cases of their eyes; there was speech in their dumbnes

instruction: Yes, good fool.
response: Alas, sir, how fell you besides your five wits?

instruction: By God! Who's there?
response: Ratcliffe, my lord, tis I.

instruction: It won't help you to try to make us feel sorry for you. After our sentence has been handed down, it's too late to complain.
response: Then thus I turn me from my country's light, To dwell in solemn shades of endless night.

instruction: It will be royal fun, I promise you. I know my medicine will work on him. You two will hide, along with the Fool, in the place where I'll leave the letter. Then you can observe how he interprets it. But for tonight, it's time to go to bed and dream about this plan. Farewell.
response: Good night, Penthesilea.

instruction: No, either tell me where you've been, or I won't say a word in your defense. My lady Olivia will have you hanged for being absent.
response: Let her hang me.

instruction: If he's gullible and believes my story, then I'll make him happy to pretend to be Vincentio and vouch for you to Baptista Minola, just as if he were the real Vincentio. Take your sweetheart and leave this to me.
response: God save you, sir.

instruction: We have to obey the gods above. I can rage as loud as the sea and it won't bring Thaisa back. I named our daughter Marina because she was born at sea. Please, I'm asking a favor: I'm leaving the baby in your care. Make sure she has an education fit for a princess, so she grows up to be as cultivated as her pedigree.
response: Fear not, my lord, but think Your grace, that fed my country with your corn, For which the people's prayers still fall upon you, Must in your child be thought on.

instruction: What's the matter?
response: My lord is fall'n into an epilepsy.This is his second fit.

instruction: His hatred of mankind is what gives us advice, not his concern for our craft.
response: I'll believe him as an enemy, and give over my trade.

instruction: [To SEBASTIAN] Ha, ha, ha!
response: So youre paid.

instruction: What do you mean by "removal?"
response: Why, by making him uncapable of Othellos place: knocking out his brains.

instruction: I am; so come down and welcome me.
response: Do me some service, ere I come to thee.

instruction: Where are you, jailer? Give me a cup of wine.
response: You shall have wine enough, my lord, anon.

instruction: Ah, my poor princes! Ah, my tender babesmy flowers who didn't have a chance to bloom! If your gentle souls are still flying about in the air and haven't yet landed in their final resting place, then hover about me now with your airy wings, and hear your mother's cries of mourning.
response: [aside] Hover about her; say that right for rightHath dimmed your infant morn to agèd night.

instruction: Only from my kind uncle. I know he'll give it to me, and it's not valuable, so it shouldn't make him sad to lose it.
response: A greater gift than that Ill give my cousin.

instruction: And we're with you, whatever happens.
response: Good uncle, take you in this barbarous Moor, This ravenous tiger, this accursed devil; Let him receive no sustenance, fetter him Till he be brought unto the empress' face, For testimony of her foul proceedings: And see the ambush of our fri

instruction: Hic ibat, as I told you before, Simois, I am Lucentio, hic est, son of Vincentio of Pisa, Sigeia tellus, disguised like this to win your love. Hic steterat, and the other "Lucentio" who comes to woo you, Priami, is my servant Tranio, regia, pretending to be me, celsa senis, so we can trick the foolish old Gremio.
response: [as LITIO] Madam, my instruments in tune.

instruction: What do you think of this fool, Malvolio? Hasn't he gotten better?
response: Yes, and shall do till the pangs of death shake him.

instruction: Here's the wine.
response: Flaminius, I have noted thee always wise.

instruction: Welcome, my lord. What's the news?
response: First, to thy sacred state wish I all happiness.

instruction: And wasn't my husband the bigger troublemaker out of you two?
response: We were as twinn'd lambs that did frisk i' the sun, And bleat the one at the other: what we changed Was innocence for innocence; we knew not The doctrine of ill-doing, nor dream'd That any did.

instruction: I'll believe every word you say. But let me ask: how did you get here? Where were you born?
response: The king my father did in Tarsus leave me; Till cruel Cleon, with his wicked wife, Did seek to murder me: and having woo'd A villain to attempt it, who having drawn to do't, A crew of pirates came and rescued me; Brought me to Mytilene.

instruction: His words are so passionate that he must believe what he's saying. But I can hardly believe it. Please be true, imagination, oh please be truelet it be true that I've been mistaken for you, my dear brother!
response: Come hither, knight.

instruction: It would be very difficult, I think, to arrange it so you could watch the two of them sleep together. They'd be damned if anyone else saw them having sex. So, what now? What should we do? What should I say? How could you be satisfied that you know the truth? It is impossible that you should see them in the act, even if they were frisky as goats, monkeys, or wolves in heat, as lustful as drunk idiots. But nonetheless, I tell you, if you would be satisfied to find strong circumstantial evidence pointing to the truth, you could then find such satisfaction.
response: Give me a living reason shes disloyal.

instruction: My master's behavior in his passion for you is the same as yours in your passion for me.
response: Here, wear this jewel for me.

instruction: Wait, now, who does the title, "fool," attend now?
response: He last asked the question.

instruction: Oh, do you read, my lord, what shes written? "Rape. Chiron. Demetrius."
response: What, what!

instruction: Before you do that, this sword will tear out your bowels.
response: Stay, murderous villains!

instruction: If I could, I'd spend nine years killing him slowly. She was a fine woman! A beautiful woman! A sweet woman!
response: Nay, you must forget that.

instruction: It is, my lord. Everything's ready.
response: Good Norfolk, hie thee to thy charge.

instruction: Good aunt, stand up.
response: I do not sue to stand;Pardon is all the suit I have in hand.

instruction: The old rooster, Gonzalo.
response: The cockerel.

instruction: No, don't misunderstand meI'm just stating the facts. Where are you from, sir? What name should I call you?
response: Petruchio is my name, Antonios son,A man well known throughout all Italy.

instruction: God is just, and he rewards the innocent.
response: O, twas the foulest deed to slay that babe,And the most merciless that e'er was heard of!

instruction: He should be ashamed for sending it to me, because I have heard him say a thousand times that his Julia gave him this ring when they said goodbye. Though his false finger has abused the ring, my finger will not do his Julia so much wrong by wearing the ring.
response: She thanks you.

instruction: That request is like giving me a dog, and as payment asking for the dog back.
response: Belong you to the Lady Olivia, friends?

instruction: Probably some noble gentleman on a journey, who wants to stop and rest here.
response: How now!

instruction: [To himself] The real Duke of Milan and his even finer daughter could control you right now, if now were the right time to do it. Theyve fallen in love at first sight! [To ARIEL] Beautiful Ariel, Ill set you free for making this happen.[To FERDINAND] May I speak with you, sir? Im afraid youve may have said something untrue. It wont take more than a moment.
response: [ aside] Why speaks my father so ungently?

instruction: She's looking really pregnant all of a sudden. She'll go into labor soon!
response: What wisdom stirs amongst you?

instruction: I think she means that there was more than one who did this; yes, there was more than one. Unless shes praying to heaven for revenge.
response: Lucius, what book is that she tosseth so?

instruction: See, the clock scolds me for wasting time. Don't worry, youth, I won't keep pursuing you. And when you're older and wiser, your future wife will have a fine handsome husband. There's your way back home, due west.
response: Then westward ho!Grace and good disposition attend your ladyship!Youll nothing, madam, to my lord by me?

instruction: I'll do my best, sir.
response: This Tarsus, o'er which I have the government, A city on whom plenty held full hand, For riches strew'd herself even in the streets; Whose towers bore heads so high they kiss'd the clouds, And strangers ne'er beheld but wondered at; Whose m

instruction: So we hear that the Welshmen have abandoned him, and Salisbury went to meet the king, who recently landed with a few close friends upon this coast.
response: The news is very fair and good, my lord:Richard not far from hence hath hid his head.

instruction: You won't pay for the glasses you've broken?
response: No, not a denier.

instruction: Where is he?
response: In her chamber, Making a sermon of continency to her, And rails and swears and rates, that she, poor soul, Knows not which way to stand, to look, to speak, And sits as one new-risen from a dream.

instruction: Youve often started to tell me who I am. But then you would stop, leaving me asking questions that you wouldn't answer until you would finally say, Wait. Not yet.
response: The hours now come.

instruction: Petruchio is my name. My father was Antonio, a man well known throughout Italy.
response: I know him well.

instruction: Yes, you should spend your life trying to get yourself out of any trouble that might lead to the hangmans collar.
response: I strike quickly, being moved.

instruction: This fellow is wise enough to play the fool, and to do that well you have to be clever. He has to pay attention to the mood and status of the person he's mocking, the time, and must also pursue every target he sees. This is a skill that requires just as much work as any wise man's job, for he plays the fool very wisely. Wise men, on the other hand, ruin their reputation for intelligence when they try to play the fool.
response: Save you, gentleman.

instruction: Im sorry, good Mercutio. My business was so important that I must be forgiven for stretching good manners and courtesy.
response: Thats as much as to say, such a case as yours constrains a man to bow in the hams.

instruction: What a nice trick! See how the young folks put their heads together to deceive the old.
response: Master, master, look about you.

instruction: Yep, I was born a gentleman about four hours ago!
response: And so have I, boy.

instruction: Look at me, the women who was once the object of all your promises. I received them deeply in my heart. How often have you split the bottom of my heart when you broke a promise! Oh, Proteus, let my outfit make you blush! Be ashamed that I have been wearing such immodest clothingif it can be shameful to wear a disguise for the sake of love. It's much more appropriate and a lesser fault for women to be deceptive in their appearance than for men to be deceptive in their love.
response: Than men their minds!

instruction: Go with me to the tomb.
response: I dare not, sir.

instruction: You harpy! You use your beautiful face to get away with evil.
response: You are like one that superstitiouslyDoth swear to the gods that winter kills the flies:But yet I know you'll do as I advise.

instruction: [Whispering] Damn, go hang yourself, you badger!
response: [reads] I may command where I adore, But silence, like a Lucrece knife,With bloodless stroke my heart doth gore;M.O.A.I.

instruction: Is this really happening?
response: ( sings ) But I will never die.

instruction: Yes, sir.
response: Then here is a supplication for you.

instruction: How much money do I get?
response: Come, sirrah, you must be hanged.

instruction: Nobody. I did it to myself. Farewell. Send my love to my kind lord. Oh, farewell!
response: Why, how should she be murdered?

instruction: Well, sir, in conclusion, the gown is not for me.
response: You are i' the right, sir, tis for my mistress.

instruction: No indeed, sir, the Lady Olivia has no foolishness. She won't keep a fool until she gets married. Fools are to husbands as anchovies are to sardineshusbands are the larger version. I'm not her fool, just her corrupter of words.
response: I saw thee late at the Count Orsinos.

instruction: It's unnatural to want to take revenge on the man who loves you.
response: It is a quarrel just and reasonableTo be revenged on him that killed my husband.

instruction: None, my man. They'd do nothing. Theyd all be whores and scoundrels.
response: I would with such perfection govern, sir,T' excel the Golden Age.

instruction: The most heavenly music! I can't stop listening; and it's making me sleepy. Let me rest.
response: A pillow for his head: So, leave him all.

instruction: We just miss your mother to say "amen."
response: And that would she for twenty thousand more.

instruction: How's it going, old boy?
response: Welcome, you!How now, you?What, you!Fellow, you!And thus much for greeting.

instruction: You are very sensible, but you mistook my meaning: I meant that Hortensio is afraid of you.
response: He that is giddy thinks the world turns round.

instruction: The woman I told you about, our great captain's captain, left under bold Iago's watch. She's come here seven days earlier than I expected. May Jove guard Othello and send his ship quickly here, so that he may bless us with his arrival, embrace Desdemona in love, and rekindle the fire in our spirits, bringing comfort to all of Cyprus.
response: Oh, behold, The riches of the ship is come on shore!

instruction: Heaven knows the truth.
response: Heaven truly knows that thou art false as hell.

instruction: Calm down, Petruchio. I'll vouch for Grumio. Why, this is sad to see you two fightingyou and Grumio, your trusty, cheerful servant of many years. But tell me now, sweet friend, what lucky wind blew you from old Verona here to Padua.
response: Such wind as scatters young men through the world To seek their fortunes farther than at home, Where small experience grows.

instruction: [To GONZALO] Please, stop.
response: Well, I have done.

instruction: Come on, get moving, get moving, get moving! The second rooster has crowed. The curfew-bell has rung. Its three oclock. Go get the baked meats, good Angelica. Dont worry about the cost.
response: Go, you cot-quean, go.Get you to bed, faith.

instruction: Andlike a traitor to the name of Godyou broke that vow, and with your treacherous sword you ripped open the chest of your king, Henry's, son Edward.
response: Whom thou wert sworn to cherish and defend.

instruction: Oh, wait! The statue was just painted and it's not dry yet. [LEONTES begins to cry]
response: My lord, your sorrow was too sore laid on, Which sixteen winters cannot blow away, So many summers dry; scarce any joy Did ever so long live; no sorrow But kill'd itself much sooner.

instruction: Show me a villain that's raped someone, and I'm here to take revenge on him.
response: Show me a thousand that have done thee wrong,And I will be revenged on them all.

instruction: I always do.
response: Madam, his majesty doth call for you,And for your Grace, and yours, my gracious lords.

instruction: But my hair still suits me well enough, doesn't it?
response: Excellent.

instruction: I'm surprised, but happy to see that you made it here before me. Oh, my soul is overjoyed! If this is my reward for every sea-storm, then let the winds rage and blow all they can, and let my ships have to climb up mountainous waves and drop down from their crests as if falling from heaven to hell! If I were to die now, I'd die at my happiest moment. I don't think my soul will ever be as happy as this again.
response: The heavens forbidBut that our loves and comforts should increase,Even as our days do grow.

instruction: Let me discuss your situation with you.
response: Thou canst not speak of that thou dost not feel.

instruction: There's a lot you would do. What rank are your parents?
response: Above my fortunes, yet my state is well.I am a gentleman.

instruction: [To RATCLIFFE] You'll live to regret this later.
response: Dispatch.

instruction: You said you'd be my boyfriend.
response: Thou hast sworn it more to me:Then whither goest?

instruction: I'll be here, right by your side. Be bold, and make a stand.
response: I have no great devotion to the deed And yet he hath given me satisfying reasons.

instruction: What does she say about my bravery?
response: O, sir, she makes no doubt of that.

instruction: I'll do whatever you'd like, if I can.
response: I hope thou wilt.

instruction: Yes, it is, I promise. Just read it.
response: Give me.

instruction: What! This gentleman will out-talk us all.
response: [as CAMBIO] Sir, give him head; I know hell prove a jade.

instruction: I am in love. But the one I love does not love me back.
response: Alas, that love, so gentle in his view,Should be so tyrannous and rough in proof!

instruction: Sorry, sir, I dont know Jupiter; Ive never had a drink with him in my life.
response: Why, villain, art not thou the carrier?

instruction: Then they're cold friends to me. What are they doing in the north when they should be serving their king in the west?
response: They have not been commanded, mighty king.

instruction: [Drawing a large circle on the stage with his staff] All you elves of hills, streams, lakes, and forests; and you elves who leave no footprints on the sand, chasing the ocean waves as they draw down the beach and running from those same waves when they come back; you puppet-sized creatures that by the light of the moon make fairy-rings in the grass, which a sheep will refuse to eat; and you who like to make mushrooms at midnight, and who celebrate when you hear the bells signaling the arrival of nightwith your help (though none of you are powerful) I've darkened the noon sun, summoned the rebellious winds, and made the green sea and blue sky war against each other. I've shot off the dreadful rumbling thunderbolt, and burned up Jupiter's strong oak with his own lightning. I've made the sturdy cliffs shake, and pulled up pine and cedar trees by the roots. With my strong magic, I've woken the dead and opened their graves to let them out. But now I reject this wild magic. And after I have conjured some heavenly musicas Im doing nowto achieve my goal of affecting the senses of those at whom I aim my spell, Ill break my staff. Then I'll bury it deep underground, and throw my book of magic into the sea so that it sinks farther than any anchor has ever reached.
response: A solemn air and the best comforter To an unsettled fancy cure thy brains, Now useless, boiled within thy skull.

instruction: By Saint Paul, that is bad news indeed. Oh, the king has kept many bad habits all his life, and now they've consumed his health. It's very sad to think about. Where is he, in his bed?
response: He is.

instruction: I know you are now, sir, born a gentleman.
response: Ay, and have been so any time these four hours.

instruction: Romeo can be, though God is not. Oh, Romeo, Romeo! Who ever would have guessed? Romeo!
response: What devil art thou that dost torment me thus?

instruction: If you do that, I'll never love you again. Why would you do such a thing, you silly gentleman?
response: It is silliness to live when to live is torment, and then have we a prescription to die when death is our physician.

instruction: Truly sir, don't say sounless you want to be one of my friends.
response: [giving a coin] Thou shalt not be the worse for me: theres gold.

instruction: He wont be a part of it; well keep him here. Then what is that to him?
response: Away, fond woman!

instruction: Oh, you're sick with vanity, Malvolio, and it affects your good taste. If you were generous, innocent, and friendly, then you wouldn't make such mountains out of mole-hills. There's no real harm in a professional fool, even if he does nothing but mock people. In the same way there's no real mockery in a wise man, even if he does nothing but criticize people.
response: Now Mercury endue thee with leasing, for thou speakest well of fools!

instruction: Id bet fourteen of my teethbut, to be honest, I actually only have four teeththat shes not fourteen. How long is it until August 1st?
response: A fortnight and odd days.

instruction: Come, let's leave her. May the gods help her!
response: Mark'd he your music?

instruction: [To STEPHANO and TRINCULO] Go, and return that trash you're wearing to where you found it.
response: Or stole it, rather.

instruction: And until she comes, I'll tell you the story of how Desdemona and I fell in love as truthfully as I confess my sins to God.
response: Say it, Othello.

instruction: Perfect, Sir Topas!
response: Nay, I am for all waters.

instruction: Master, now's not the time to scold you. Affection can't be driven out of the heart. If love has really touched you, then there's only one thing to be done. As the Latin grammar book says, "Ransom yourself from captivity as cheaply as you can."
response: Gramercies, lad, go forward.

instruction: Oh, is that it? What will you give me now for the handkerchief itself?
response: What handkerchief?

instruction: Will you go to dinner with her?
response: Yes, I intend so.

instruction: And you too, good sister-in-law. Where are you off to?
response: No farther than the Tower, and, as I guess,Upon the like devotion as yourselves, To gratulate the gentle princes there.

instruction: [Waking up] Why, whats happening? Hey, wake up!
response: Whats the matter?

instruction: [Singing]I wont build any more dams to catch you fish,Whenever you want,Or scrape clean the platters, or wash dishes.'Ban, 'Ban, Ca-CalibanHas a new master. Get yourself a new servant.Freedom, hooray, hooray, freedom, freedom, hooray, freedom!
response: O brave monster!

instruction: Is the handkerchief lost? Is it gone? Tell me, have you lost it?
response: Bless us!

instruction: [To CHIRON and DEMETRIUS] Since hes crazy, Ill just keep agreeing with him. Whatever I come up with, just support my story in whatever you sayfor now he thinks Im Revenge. And, since hell be easy to deceive now, Ill make him bring his son Lucius to his house. And during the banquet, Ill find some cunning way to destroy the Goth army, or at least to make them turn against him. Look, here he comes; I have to keep this up.
response: Long have I been forlorn, and all for thee: Welcome, dread Fury, to my woful house: Rapine and Murder, you are welcome too.

instruction: [As LUCENTIO] No, she's a devil, a devil, the devil's own mother.
response: Tut, shes a lamb, a dove, a fool to him!

instruction: She's just what you want after a long voyage at sea. [He gives the BAWD a coin] Well, there you go. Leave us.
response: I beseech your honour, give me leave: a word, andI'll have done presently.

instruction: You have. Where was she born? Speak. Tell me.
response: Sir, in Argier.

instruction: Oh, do not slander him, for he is a kind man.
response: As snow in harvest.

instruction: This will be a splendid kingdom for me to rule. I'll get music played to me for free.
response: When Prospero is destroyed.

instruction: What do you want me to do? Fight in the war, huh? Where a man might serve seven years before he loses a leg, and then not have enough money to buy a wooden one?
response: Do any thing but this thou doest.

instruction: Me neither.
response: Look you, I love you well; I'll give you gold, Rid me these villains from your companies: Hang them or stab them, drown them in a draught, Confound them by some course, and come to me, I'll give you gold enough.

instruction: We'll both draw our swords. When I raise my sword, you do the same, and bring it down to kill Gonzalo.
response: O, but one word.

instruction: [She hands SILVIA a letter] Madam, please read this letterWait! Pardon me, madam. I have accidentally given you a paper that I shouldn't have. [She hands SILVIA another letter] This is the letter addressed to your Ladyship.
response: I pray thee, let me look on that again.

instruction: It is a crazy world indeed, my lord. And I believe it will never stand upright again until Richard wears the garland of the realm.
response: How wear the garland?

instruction: Tell us more with more gold. We'll do anything for gold!
response: Consumptions sow In hollow bones of man; strike their sharp shins, And mar men's spurring.

instruction: This can't be true. It makes no sense. It must be a trick, to draw our attention in the wrong direction. Think about how important Cyprus is to the Turks, and think how much more the Turks care about Cyprus than Rhodes. And also consider that they can take over Cyprus more easily than Rhodes, since it doesn't have the same military defenses that Rhodes has. Considering all this, we cannot think that the Turks would be so foolish as to leave Cyprus for later when it would be easiest to take first. They wouldn't neglect an easy, profitable mission to undertake a dangerous one that wouldn't benefit them as much.
response: Nay, in all confidence, hes not for Rhodes.

instruction: [Kneels]May my knees grow into the earth and my tongue stick to roof of my mouth, unless you pardon me before I stand up or speak.
response: Intended or committed was this fault?

instruction: Yes, yes.
response: You scarcely have the hearts to tell me so,And therefore cannot have the hearts to do it.

instruction: The oracle is complete garbage. The trial will proceed. This is a pack of lies.
response: My lord the king, the king!

instruction: I thank you, madam, that you care for her. Poor gentlewoman! My master has really wronged her.
response: Dost thou know her?

instruction: Enough, enough.
response: O princely Buckingham, Ill kiss thy hand In sign of league and amity with thee.

instruction: You may have heard that, but you must be somewhat hard of hearing then. Those who talk about me call me Katherine.
response: You lie, in faith, for you are called plain Kate, And bonny Kate, and sometimes Kate the curst, But Kate, the prettiest Kate in Christendom, Kate of Kate Hall, my super-dainty Kate For dainties are all Kates and therefore, Kate, Take this o

instruction: Just do it. And quickly. I will walk around. I would not want to kill you when you haven't prepared your soul by confessing and repenting. No, heaven forbid it, I would not send your soul to hell.
response: Talk you of killing?

instruction: If you don't mind, I'll leave my flag-bearer behind for the task. He is an honest, trustworthy man, and I'll let him bring my wife to Cyprus, along with whatever else your good grace thinks I might need.
response: Let it be so.

instruction: My dearest father, if you used your magic to incite the wild waters into this this awful storm, please calm them. The sky is so dark it seems like it would rain down hot tar, except that the sea is swelling up to the sky and would put out the fire boiling the tar. Oh, I've suffered along with all of those I saw suffering onboard the ship! A magnificent shipwhich carried, without a doubt, some noble peoplewas smashed to pieces. Oh, their cries shook my heart! Those poor peoplethey died. If I were a god with even a bit of power I would have forced the sea to sink down into the earth before it could have swallowed up that ship and all the people it carried.
response: Be collected.No more amazement.

instruction: She was, good Curtis, before this frost. But you know how winter tames man, woman, and beastand so it's tamed my old master, my new mistress, and myself, good colleague Curtis.
response: Away, you three-inch fool!

instruction: And that's harm?
response: Men daily find it.

instruction: So, Prince of Tyre: you understand how dangerous the task you're about to attempt is?
response: I have, Antiochus, and, with a soulEmbolden'd with the glory of her praise,Think death no hazard in this enterprise.

instruction: As for him, I don't think about him. And as for his thoughts, I wish that they were blank pages instead of filled with pictures of me.
response: Madam, I come to whet your gentle thoughtsOn his behalf.

instruction: But he is your servant, so all that he has is yours too. Your servant's servant is your servant, madam.
response: For him, I think not on him.

instruction: I don't know, madam.
response: Believe me, I had rather have lost my purse Full of crusadoes.

instruction: It's truly beautifulyour red lips and white skin painted by Nature's sweet and skillful hand. My lady, you are the cruelest woman alive if you'll let your beauty go with you to the grave, instead of having children and passing it on.
response: O, sir, I will not be so hard-hearted.

instruction: [To his men] Follow me closely. Ill speak to them.
response: And but one word with one of us?

instruction: I'm glad he's coming, however he might be dressed.
response: Why, sir, he comes not.

instruction: The loss can never be repaired, and patiently waiting for the pain to fade is not going to work.
response: I rather think You have not sought her help, of whose soft grace For the like loss I have her sovereign aid, And rest myself content.

instruction: He's a coward, a true coward, religiously devoted to his cowardice.
response: 'Slid, Ill after him again and beat him.

instruction: What do you want, my lordexcept for the one thing you cannot havethat I can help you with? Cesario, you broke your promise to me.
response: Madam?

instruction: Wait, officer. He won't go to prison.
response: Talk not, Signior Gremio.

instruction: I hope Lady Luck is on our side!
response: See, your guests approach:Address yourself to entertain them sprightly,And let's be red with mirth.

instruction: Get up, good aunt.
response: Not yet, I thee beseech: For ever will I walk upon my knees, And never see day that the happy sees, Till thou give joy; until thou bid me joy, By pardoning Rutland, my transgressing boy.

instruction: But not better than mine.
response: Well, sir.

instruction: That honorable day will never be seen. Since his banishment, Norfolk has been fighting for Jesus Christ in the Holy Land; afterwards, he retired to Italy and died in Venice, surrendering his pure soul to his captain Christ, under whose flag he had fought for so long.
response: Why, bishop, is Norfolk dead?

instruction: He hasn't arrived yet. And I don't know anything, but I'm sure he's all right and will be here soon
response: Oh, but I fear.

instruction: So far you havent hurt me much. You will soon, though, I can tell by your trembling. Prospero made you do this.
response: [trying to give CALIBAN drink] Come on your ways.

instruction: And they never sent you away?
response: Never.

instruction: Error in the bill, sir, error in the bill! I said that the sleeves should be cut out and sewed up again, and I'll prove it by defeating you in combat, even if your little finger is armed with a thimble.
response: This is true that I say: an I had thee in place where,thou shouldst know it.

instruction: I hope you'll pardon me: I can't walk these streets without being in danger. Once in a battle at sea I served on the side fighting against Duke Orsino's ships, and I distinguished myself enough that I might be recognized. If I were arrested here, they'd make me answer for my deeds.
response: Belike you slew great number of his people?

instruction: It's thought the king is dead; we will not wait. The bay-trees in our country are all withered, and meteors disturb the fixed stars in the sky; the pale-faced moon looks bloody on the earth; and frightened prophets whisper of fearful change. Rich men look sad and poor men dance and leap, the one fearing to lose what they enjoy, the other looking forward to enjoying the spoils of war: these signs predict the death or fall of kings. Farewell, our countrymen are as surely gone as Richard is dead.
response: Ah, Richard, with the eyes of heavy mind I see thy glory like a shooting star Fall to the base earth from the firmament.

instruction: I've heard people say that engineering their multicoloredness is "playing God."
response: Say there be; Yet nature is made better by no mean But nature makes that mean: so, over that art Which you say adds to nature, is an art That nature makes.

instruction: And ours.
response: All our bills.

instruction: Do you think so?
response: Think so, Iago?

instruction: Here comes the little villain.
response: How now, my metal of India?

instruction: Just a minute, shepherd. Do you have a father?
response: I have: but what of him?

instruction: God be with you. I'm finished with my business. If you please, your Grace, you can move on to the state affairs. I'd rather adopt a child than father my own. Come here, Moor. I now give you with all my heart my daughter, whom I'd keep from you with all my heart if you didn't already have her. For your sake, precious Desdemona, I am glad that I don't have another daughter. For what you have done would make me a tyrannical parent, and I'd lock her up like a prisoner. [To the DUKE] I'm done with my business, my lord.
response: Let me speak like yourself and lay a sentence Which, as a grise or step, may help these lovers Into your favor.

instruction: Then she cursed Richard, then she cursed Buckingham, and then she cursed Hastings. Oh, God, remember to hear her prayer and punish them as you now punish us! But, dear God, please be satisfied with our bloodwhich is being unjustly spilledand don't punish my sister and her princely sons.
response: Make haste.

instruction: Alas, why would you heap this responsibility on me? I am unfit for power and majesty. Don't take this the wrong way, but I cannot and will not give in to you.
response: If you refuse it, as in love and zeal Loath to depose the child, your brothers son As well we know your tenderness of heart And gentle, kind, effeminate remorse, Which we have noted in you to your kindred And equally indeed to all estates Y

instruction: Have I ever seen two such honest men?
response: Sir, Having often of your open bounty tasted, Hearing you were retired, your friends fall'n off, Whose thankless naturesO abhorred spirits!

instruction: You've got the right idea. [To MALVOLIO] Go rub your steward's chain in some crumbs, sir. Maria, bring us more wine!
response: Mistress Mary, if you prized my ladys favor at anything more than contempt, you would not give means for this uncivil rule.

instruction: Your own is yours, and I am yours, and everything.
response: So far be mine, my most redoubted lord,As my true service shall deserve your love.

instruction: Everything's ready. How far away is our master?
response: E'en at hand, alighted by this.

instruction: With all my heart, I will.
response: At nine i' th' morning here well meet again.

instruction: [To MARIA] Please, keep quiet. This isn't the way to go about it. Don't you see that you're making him upset? Leave me alone with him.
response: No way but gentleness, gently, gently.

instruction: Hear me, you scheming pirates, who quarrel over what you've plundered from me! Which of you doesn't tremble to look at me? If you're not trembling because I am the queen and you are my bowing subjects, then you're quivering because you're traitors who stole my throne!
response: Foul, wrinkled witch, what makst thou in my sight?

instruction: Come on, captain, will you go now?
response: Have with you.

instruction: Certainly. Let our catch be "You Villain."
response: Hold thy peace, thou knave, knight?

instruction: Are you really jealous of me because of him? You must be jokingand now I can see that you've been joking with me this whole time. Please, sister Kate, untie my hands.
response: If that be jest, then all the rest was so.

instruction: But there is one man who loves you better than your husband could.
response: Name him.

instruction: Did Cassio confess to it?
response: Good sir, be a man, Think every bearded fellow thats but yoked May draw with you.

instruction: Good man, speak to the sailors to get them working harder. Do it quickly, or were going to be shipwrecked. Move, move!
response: Heigh, my hearts!

instruction: I will chop her up into little bits! Cheat on me, will she?
response: Oh, tis foul in her.

instruction: Come on, lets knock and go inside. And once inside, lets all start dancing.
response: A torch for me.

instruction: Perdita, please don't ruin the party by worrying. I belong to you, sweetheart, not my father.
